title: 5.0 out of 5 stars This review will likely confuse you...
author: Radio guy
content: First of all, my Bose sound link mini (not the sound link mini II) It is at least 15 years old... So silly me, I thought sound technology has come a long way in 15 years so I better get a new BT speaker hoping to upgrade the sound. Well after trying the JBL Charge 5 and then later the Marshall Emberton II, I am sticking with my old Bose.This is the environment that I tested all three speakers...I use my speaker outside on the patio. Never louder than 30-40% volume as the houses are pretty close. (normal subdivision) .A / B tests...I had two other people give me their opinions (blind speaker tests) All of us picked my old Bose Sound Link Mini as sounding better then both the Charge 5 and Marshall E II.My music background is strictly non technical, but I do know good sounding music and good mid to high end theater sound. This is my option using them in the environment that I listed above. The old Bose just sounded more open especially at lower volumes. ( I think they call it "sound stage") You may be saying BS but I didn't expect the winner to be the Bose either. but, three different ears picked the Bose. The Marshall always came in ahead of the JBL C 5 in sound, design and looks. So if you need IP67 or longer battery life than go with the Marshall II. But again I think the Bose had slightly better overall sound to me.Take this info with a grain of salt but after hours of testing this was my conclusion.I have also read the the newer Bose speakers like the Sound link mini II or special edition are not as good as the older one that I have... ??? But I have not heard them.I hope it helps.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars You will not regret this purchase!
author: The Best Yak Ever
content: Okay, I love this little speaker. I had a cheapo DOSS speaker that was roughly the same size for my bathroom. I wanted my bathroom to have a Bluetooth enabled sound system to connect to an old iPad Air 2 that I have mounted on an articulating wall mount. I thought it’d be a perfect use for my old iPad but found that the DOSS system couldn’t get loud enough to hear over the running shower. I have always loved Bose products and decided to try out this system. It was inexpensive and produces phenomenal sound for such a small package. Not only can I listen to music without needing it to be cranked to max volume, but podcasts and YouTube videos come through loud and clear with the shower running full bore. I would have settled for a power cord reliant speaker, but this thing has a battery with great battery life. I have moved it to the kitchen while I cleaned, my soap workshop, and my garage shop. It’s ultra portable and amazing. Buy one of these pups, and don’t waste your money and time with cheaper systems. You’ll get what you pay for and won’t regret it. I ended up being so impressed that I also ordered a Bose Soundtouch 20 for my kitchen and a 30 for my living room. I guess almost every room in my house has an awesome sound system in it (media room has a Lifestyle 650 and bedroom has an older Lifestyle T20). The result, a house with incredible sound and music capacity.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars The LAST Soundlink Mini!
author: M. H. Brandon
content: Back in the day, I was an early adopter of the original Soundlink Mini. I enjoyed it but Bose had severe battery problems. It was out of warranty and wouldn't keep a charge. Then the Soundlink Mini II came out and I loved it. Better sound, speakerphone capability and that awful battery problem that Bose STILL didn't fix. I actually hadn't used it all that much and knowing the properties of lithium-ion batteries, couldn't believe it wouldn't hold a charge.I had the same problems with my Bose Soundsport Free true wireless earphones. The case wouldn't hold a charge!So I needed a good Bluetooth speaker. I found that Bose was still manufacturing the Limited Edition Soundlink Mini. I ran across a YouTube video comparing the Mini to the new Bose Revolve speaker. The author of the video used binaural microphones to record the sound signature to the viewer. To cut to the chase, the Mini sounded BETTER than the new Revolve! I won't get into the sound characteristics but to my ears, I enjoyed the MINI sound much more.The dilemma.... do I buy the Mini, Revolve or look elsewhere? I needed a speaker that was rich sounding, had speakerphone capability and was small enough for my needs. Taking a big chance, as I'm sure BOSE never fixed the battery issue, I bought the MINI. When I unboxed it and starting charging it, the battery was totally dead as I could tell by the length of time it took to charge it. It's early, but everything is working well but I haven't drained the battery yet.BOSE...being a prodigious company that enjoys over the top profits like Apple, probably had a bunch of these things in a warehouse or shipped to retailers that sat and collected dust. The point is: if you like this product like I do, then buy one as they're not going to last long. Buy a warranty but if it malfunctions, don't be surprised if BOSE can't/won't repair it. In that case, they won't have a replacement for you and you'll have to be satisfied with a refund.To wrap this up, enjoy the sound like I do and good luck if the battery issue rears its ugly head.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2019

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best small Bluetooth speakers
author: Steve Pugliese
content: This is an older Bose Bluetooth speaker that has been discontinued. I first heard this when someone brought one to a presentation. I have the Bose Soundlink Color II, which I liked very much. But it struck me immediately that this Soundlink Mini II Limited sounded significantly better. The bass response alone was a revelation. I had to get one before they disappeared.This is a very small speaker, smaller than the Color II (though this weighs a bit more). But its sound is truly exceptional, as so many have stated. You have to experience that much sound coming from this tiny thing to really appreciate it. Disregard reviews that criticize its sound. I have no idea what they're talking about. This thing sounds great in every way. It gets quite loud depending on your Bluetooth source. Highs are crisp and defined with a darn good mid range. But that bass! How do they do that? It's such a kick!Don't know what the battery and Bluetooth issues are that some have complained about. I've no problems with those at all so far. Holds a charge for at least six hours, as far as I can tell. Pairs immediately. No dropouts. Smooth sailing all the way.For a speaker you could throw in the smallest bag, this thing rocks. I gave the Color II away. Just highly recommended.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound Quality, Battery Issues
author: Wahkeena Sitka
content: I have dualistic feelings about this speaker. I will give you the Pros & the Cons.I've had this Bose Soundlink Mini II Speaker for about 2 months now.Pros:The Sound Quality is FANTASTIC. It's truly amazing. This speaker gives incredible bass and high quality sound. I love the portability of it. I don't have any problems pairing this with my computer and my phone. Truly a great speaker in terms of sound quality.Cons:I discovered a month after I received it that it stopped charging. For a few days, it was completely unable to charge while either being directly plugged in or sitting on the charging port. Nothing worked for several days and the battery % kept dropping. Then I went through page after page of old reviews on this product and other Bose Bluetooth speakers. And then I discovered that this is a common problem on ALL Bose Bluetooth speakers. And then I started researching other bluetooth speakers by other companies, such as Sony and JBL. Turns out ALL bluetooth speakers have issues with them losing the ability to charge the battery. It's an industry problem among bluetooth speakers. Disheartened, due to the prevalence of the problem among all bluetooth speakers, I decided to keep the speaker because there appeared to be no better option available.Fortunately, the speaker started charging again and I haven't had any problems the last few weeks. I'm cautiously optimistic. But I'm also nervous, because if you go through Bose Soundlink Mini II reviews, you will see MANY people complaining of the same problem that seems to get worse as the months go by.Again, the sound quality is FANTASTIC. It's just a matter of finding out if these speakers have any longevity. That's my major concern. Perhaps in 10 months I can update this review to reflect how it's lasted.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2018

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars sounds great, but nothing Limited about it
author: D. Lane
content: I have many Bose products and still enjoy them all, including my original SoundLink Mini, but after 8 years the battery life has decreased significantly, as anything with a battery in it will eventually. I went to Amazon to get the newer model, the SL Mini II. The one I bought was advertised as "Limited Edition." According to Bose, this designation does not exist, and nowhere on the box or the unit does it say Limited Edition. Bose currently sells a "Special Edition," and what I received is not the SE, either. This "LE" unit has the copper-colored logo on the front, same as the regular SL-M2. I did much research on this, including two calls to Bose, so it is not lightly that I say the "Limited Edition" in the product name is misleading.After fully charged, I used my new SL-M2 for a few days. It worked great, even speakerphone mode (a new feature for the M2), but I noticed that as soon as the charging cord was pulled, it said battery was at 90% and dropping. It did not charge. I believe the unit I was sold sat on the shelf for an extended period of time, and thus affected battery life. Amazon took great steps to quickly get me a replacement unit. I'm happy for great customer service, but disappointed to get a bum speaker as brand new.UPDATE: The replacement speaker arrived, and has worked great for 2 weeks, charging as it should. I must have got a unit with a bad battery (VERY common issue, I gather), so I upped my rating, because it is an excellent product.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2020

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Phenomenal...but...
author: Pudge
content: Having owned Bose products all my life, that bar has been set, and it's hard to accept anything less than that level of quality. That being said, here comes the good and not so good with this particular product.When I received this amazing little marvel yesterday, I immediately got her synced to the Note 8 (yeah...I'm a year behind) and proceeded to cook the evening meal (in the kitchen) jamming to Amazon music. (kitchen is the key word here).The sound quality, depth, and clarity is simply amazing. I was blown away that, that rich of a sound was coming from this little speaker (in my kitchen). However, it was not my intended use for this item to be used in the kitchen. The intended use was to be in the shop I work in. Took this into work today, fully charged. (Supposedly, fully charged is good for 10 hours). After about 1 hour of trying to hear what was being played, at full volume, I swapped back over to the old Lax-Max speaker...which I have to turn the volume down with. (No, the sound quality is not quite the same...hence the attempt at the Bose purchase). Brought the Bose back home, set back in the kitchen, and when powered up, the cute little voice tells me I have 3 hours of battery life left? But wait, I only used you for an hour?Bottom line: if you don't intend to use this in a room, in your house, or in a non-background noise area...I would pass on this one. I'm on the fence at this point if I will keep or return.Sounding kick-ass in my "kitchen" right now though...Update 1-23-19: The battery seems to be holding a charge just fine, and remains in my possession
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2019

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great sound reproduction!
author: Cape Rocket Beach Bum
content: The media could not be loaded. This little speaker is amazing! Not a rich man but doing well the price was from my “treat “ fund. I first heard Bose speakers at a friends home in the early 70s, looking around trying to figure out where his tunes were coming from when he pointed to two stands with small boxes on them. They were no bigger as I recal then a small cereal box that you cut open and use as a bowl. I think he had a bass or woofer on the floor but the point being it was a tremendous sound!Jump to February of this year and I purchased this amazing speaker! I have several small blue tooth speakers in the 30 dollar range, but we are comparing watermelons to cherries here.The video is from a very inexpensive michrophone, 30 dollar range which you will see.But look at the spectrum analysis of what the mike is inputting to.Each division represents 250 Hertz (cycles per second for some of us elderly gentlemen! Lol)So at the left end you see zero to 250 Hertz in the first “square” the next division to the right is 250 to 500 Hertz. Middle C on a piano is around the “A” 440 Hertz so its in this or the next “square”. The “square” or division (sorry for going back and forth between division and square!) at the far right shows the frequencies between 2,250 Hertz and 2,500 Hertz in the over tones. Hope this makes sense. This is a visual representation of the music broken down showing the frequencies coming out of the Bose speaker through a very inexpensive microphone. If you play the video you will hear it as wellYes I will recommend this speaker to my friends!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2018

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Distorted lows, sibilant highs. The Tannoy Live Mini is better in every way.
author: Babis
content: I have been trying to find a good sounding portable speaker for the past 2 years. Tried dozens of speakers. The Bose Soundlink mini II has a pleasant sound signature that gives it a sense of clarity. Amar Bose was a professor at MIT and an expert in psychoacoustics. If you watch his lectures online, you will see that he knows how to change frequencies to give you an illusion that the sound comes from elsewhere, or is being reflected, to create the perception of a live performance. However, this coloration causes a lot of distortion in some genres. Piano sounds like a detuned, distorted mess. While the boosted treble gives a perception of clarity and detail, it can also make the speaker sound cheap, and heavily distorts focals. Female vocals can sound harsh and sibilant. Just watch How to get away with murder on Netflix and you will hear horrible distortion and hissing on S's and T's. This makes the speaker sound like a cheap radio.If you have an Samsung Android phone or tablet, there is a useful EQ under 'sound quality and effects'. These EQ settings can reduce the sibilance and distortion.63Hz +2dB125Hz -2 dB250Hz 0dB500Hz 0dB1kHz 0dB2kHz 0dB4kHz -2dB8kHz -4dB16kHz +4dBBose should have equalized this speaker better in the factory, or with a firmware updateTwo years and 20 speakers later (Bose S6 PA, Bose Portable Home Speaker, Denon Envaya BT250, Marshall Killburn II, Stockwell II, Emberton, B&O Beolit, etc), I discovered the Tannoy Live Mini and was shocked by its performance. It sounds like a studio monitor and wipes the floor with the Bose. Punchy base, clear treble and pure vocals. It also supports AptX, unlike the Bose and the Marshall Emberton.I recommend trying both the Bose Soundlink Mini II and Tannoy Live Mini and hear the difference in sound quality yourself.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2020

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Please, Bose, give us a REMOTE CONTROL
author: Christine Raymond
content: Update:1. I have discovered finally that, when paired to my Echo Dot, I can verbally control the volume by telling Alexa “volume 1” to “volume 10” or “volume up”. This wasn’t working initially, so I’m happy to finally have it controllable in this way. I would still like to have a REMOTE CONTROL.2. Battery life while not being used is really lousy. Charge it, listen for 20 minutes, come back in a day or so, battery dead. Trying to solve this without keeping it plugged in all the time.Original review: My feeling on this speaker is....eh.It’s small and the sound is great. Those are the good things.The not-so-good things:1. You can only control the volume by walking over to the speaker & pressing the up or down buttons. You can not buy a remote for it; I tried. You can not control volume through the Bose app. You literally have to press the buttons. And they’re squishy buttons that aren’t very sensitive. So, when you tell Alexa to play some Amos Lee early in the morning while you get ready for work & it comes blaring out because your husband was listening to something the day before at top volume, and you can’t get the squishy volume down button to respond quickly, it’s not pleasant.2. The battery dies quickly when not in use even when the power is off. I’m considering leaving it on the charger all the time but that’s disappointing to have to do.3. There’s no way to know the volume setting without playing a song. There’s no range of 0 to 10 on a readout. So if you were blasting it yesterday, it’s going to come blasting out today. But you won’t know to expect it because there’s no readout.There’s probably no better sounding portable/rechargeable speaker, but it has its drawbacks.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2019

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent speaker! Android+Precise Volume on Google Play = BLISS
author: ToxicWaste
content: Im not stranger to Bose products, as I'm still rocking a Cinema Series from 2001. I didn't want to spend the $ on another BT speaker, as amazingly, the high wattage Anker brand speaker works excellent (quality is degrading almost 2 years later). I saw this one and it had a discount on Amazon.My takes: the sound is hardcore, not sure what others are using but with my Galaxy Note 8 and Precise Volume app, this speaker's sound/quality range are excellent. After fully charging the battery, it's still going strong 7 hours later. Pairing is dumby proof. There's also a 3.5mm audio input for those without BT. Bose gives the speaker itself a USB-B mini input jack on the unit too.What I've noticed: the BT signal can be a bit sketchy. I have had my phone 20' from it and it would break up occasionally. I ensured my device was the only one with BT on. The Bose Connect app doesn't work with this SLM2 and that's just plain ridiculous.If you've got an Android phone with access to Google Play, download Precise Volume. You won't believe what kind of beast your phone or tablet will turn into and it translates to BT as well, making the Soundlink even more powerful.Hope this helps!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2019

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Missing identity
author: I’m pretty sure I ordered a new one versus a refurbished one

timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Hardware great, Bluetooth and battery not so great
author: Amazon Customer
content: The sound is exactly what you would expect from Bose, no surprise there. This speaker is also a tank so don’t worry about accidental drops and falls with it because it’ll just shrug them off, no problem.On the flip side, the software inside is pretty finicky. The biggest Bluetooth problems usually occur within the first couple minutes of pairing. I’ve noticed that if my phone isn’t already playing music, pairing is not automatic. Also, it loves to pick up any device that has been connected in the past. For example, I usually play music from my iPhone, but it will frequently connect to my laptop (which is closed and shut down) while I’m streaming from my phone. Another problem is using the device until the battery dies. I frequently run it from 100% to dead. But once it dies and I plug it in to charge, it will not turn on Bluetooth until it is fully charged. So you need to be aware of battery life. Better to go 10 minutes without music while looking for the charger, versus playing it till dead and having to wait until it is fully charged again.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2018

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars it looks amazing and it feels like little tank
author: Pepe
content: I`m giving 5 stars and hbere is why. 1) Look and built: it looks amazing and it feels like little tank. 2) Sound quality: having tried some competitors in this size and price range, to me this one blows away all of them. 3) Power: it is more than enough to have music all over my flat, and this might be subjective, but to me the bass is just the right one... deep, rich and very powerful. 4) Portability: ok, the guy`s heavy for its size, but still at 1,6 pounds I find portable to my needs.Having say that, I will now say when this is not for you: 1) if you need 20 hours battery life. 2) If you need water proofing. 3) If you can`t carry around 1.6 pounds and need something lighter, so far in all speakers I tested haven`t found anything lighter without compromising sound quality.So this speaker sits mainly on my desk and I move it around the house and, on ocassion take it out with friends, bluetooth connection is flawless, you can still find plenty of accessories for it in the market, like the Balolo wooden cover which is also fantastic. Really happy with it.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 23, 2018

title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound but Serious Design Flaw
author: Ted J. Wheeler
content: I received my Bose Mini II Limted Edition today. The intent was to use it on the road as I am now and at home as a computer speaker. I have a set of Bose Companion 20 speakers which are amazing but I want less wiring and more real estate on my desk at home.Of course I will use the Bluetooth option occasionally but most of my applications will be with it hard wired to a computer or other source through the AUX port.Right away I noticed a problem. There is a horrible, loud hum (like a ground fault) when it has any source connected to AUX and the USB power source connected directly to the speaker or to the charging cradle.I attempted various sources, changing cables and power supplies, other electrical outlets, moving it around. The problem persists.Incidentally, my Logitech Bluetooth UE Mini Boom speakers and my Bose Companion 20's exhibit none of this connected to same source. It is not being carried in on the input. I tried multiple audio cables on multiple sources.If you unplug either the source connected or the USB power source, the hum stops.Then I went to Google to research this problem. Many people have observed it with all the Mini II's, but not the orginal Mini.Bose has no fix. It is a design flaw in the unit where they have not properly isolated the AUX input from the power. I read where some people found it went away if they powered/charged it off the USB port on their computer. The one I received won't do it. It starts to charge and then stops. The only option to use the AUX input is to run it on battery only.For my intended purpose this can't work. The speaker is amazing in terms of sound quality from such a small unit. But Bose really messed up with this one.I want to like it, was tempted to try to live with it but the point was to end up with Bose quality, not a serious quirk. One guy in a support thread said he undocks or slides the speaker off the cradle contacts a bit when he uses it direct connected to his computer.There are too many other good products out there so I am returning this to Amazon. Extremely disappointed.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2018

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars short battery life. Probably not a good choice to be used as the office / desk speaker
author: Ruochi
content: The battery will die. Not in a sense that it only lasts 1 hour instead of x hours as it used to. It will completely die. And because of the design, you cannot just use it with AC as power. It has to be used through battery, which probably explains why the battery dies so fast. For electronics with battery, a more appropriate design would be to use AC to directly support the machine when the power surpass the required number, and switch to battery when AC is off. But Bose choose to always use battery to support the machine, letting the battery being charged and used all the time... And as compared to soundlink mini1...the battery on mini2 is soldered on the chips and hard to change on your own. Note that the version one is a plug in-n-out design. THEY DID IT ON PURPOSE. It's harder to assemble, the size of the machine doesn't change, so there is actually no benefit on changing the design, except that now their customers are forced to either buy a new speaker every 2-3 years or pay ~100$ to get the battery changed.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2021

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome
author: Jason
content: Nope, this speaker isn't waterproof.Nope, it isn't the loudest thing you've ever heard.No, it doesn't have a battery that lasts 14 days...(just for comparison - the JBL Charge 4 does these things well)BUT:For its size, the sound clarity - both highs and lows, is unrivaled.It's constructed of quality materials - has a great fit and finish.Is perfect for someone who travels a lot - this thing is awesome when you're on the go (e.g. in a hotel room).I purchased my first soundlink mini years ago, and still have it to this day. That speaker now lives at the office - and this one travels around with me.If you want a portable speaker that delivers crisp and clean audio in a tiny package - look no further - you can't beat it.One last thing - the soundlink mini II is a discontinued item - it has been replaced by the soundlink revolve. Although the revolve a good speaker, I prefer the forward firing speakers of the soundlink mini.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2020

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound
author: Sara Smithie
content: I ordered this because my other Boise speaker is well over 5 years old and just a little weary....so i read this product may go off market (why??) And i wanted to have another around. I love this little speaker...i use it all the time in my home and outside in the yard. I wouldnt reccomend it for boats and such as the platform it sits on to recharge could be ruined with dirt, dust and moisture...but you do have the ability to charge directly into the speaker itself, leaving the platform inside the home. It is definitely a great little speaker with a big sound. I get lots of comments on the quality of sound....i gave it a four-star rating only because some design engineers decided on the new model to shorten the power cord! Not sure why, but its a bit of a pain to plug in for me....i have to find the right spot rather than leaving it on a counter top....the old model had a long cord. Other than this its essentially the same great speaker. Id reccomend this product

title: 2.0 out of 5 stars Sounds great...when it works. Test ALL features
author: Reginard Millstone
content: I bought this speaker brand-new from a third-party seller on Amazon. It arrived quickly and was sealed in the retail packaging. I quickly fired it up, connecting to my phone via Bluetooth was a breeze. The sound quality was great, by the best sounding portable speaker I've owned. I also liked that it easily detects and re-pairs with my phone, rather than my POS Jambox that I would have to turn on and off every time to reconnect. It has an annoying voice that prompts you that it is connected, but that can easily be disabled.The problem started when I tried connecting my mp3 player via the AUX input. It would play great for 5-10 minutes then the sound would cut out completely. It eventually comes back on, but keeps doing this intermittently. I tried playing from different devices with different cords, same result. Tried to update the firmware but it already had the latest version. Eventually this drove me insane, as it is completely unacceptable for a BRAND NEW item. Looking online, it seems there are scores of people with the same issue.I tried to go through the Amazon returns process which was a huge hassle because I had to schedule the pickup while I was leaving for a trip. They ended up taking it back and refunding me but did not send the replacement. And of course in the meantime the price has gone up $30. Forget it, I'm not taking that chance again. Bose really needs to improve their quality control.***UPDATE***After 2 years of constant use with the Bluetooth function, this speaker has now refused to take a charge when plugged in, so now can only be used while plugged in to AC power. And wouldn't you know it's past the warranty/return window! BOOOO to you Bose, you can do better.****2ND UPDATE****Sent it in for repairs (had no choice but to pay $55) and less than a year later it stopped charging and completely bricked. Not putting another cent into this thing and never buying Bose again.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Alien Technology
author: Brian Oehm
content: 80 Watts doesn't begin to describe this speaker. It has a full range of sound in a tiny box that provides such a rich sound you wonder how it weighs so little. I would post a video of it but I do not own a microphone good enough to pick up the sound so I won't mislead you with a 4k phone video. Bose clearly broke the fabric of space and time to make this and the intergalactic alien government is going to come here to take back the dark energy that drives the Soundlink's ability to reach impossibly deep tones for such a cute little portable speaker. title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good purchase
author: cp
content: This was a replacement for my Jawbone Jambox, which died, but I loved. The Bose sound quality is great—big Pro. Two cons (in comparison to my old faithful Jambox): it’s hard to change the volume via the buttons on the Bose. You push and push but not much happens. You have to change the volume on the device it’s connected to (phone, et al). Not a huge deal, but I liked the convenience of being able to quickly change the volume on the speaker itself. Second, the Bose is heavier than my old Jawbone, which I easily carted around room to room. Again, not a huge deal but it’s a con for me in comparison to my old speaker.Overall, I’m happy with the purchase. I waited for it to go on sale, so I’m even happier that I got good quality for a competitive price.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars the best mid or small size bluetooth speaker ever

content: one gentlemen had said you should sit down before you turn this little thing on, he was 101% right - the sound is unbelievable for the size of the unit and beats much bigger speakers. unlike typical Bose sound, bass enhanced, this one has uniform distribution and nothing is left out, the highs as well as mid range frequencies are perfectly rendered. regardless your opinion of Bose merchandise, they deserve the credit for this one.unfortunately, it is pricey and hard to come by these days (thanks Amazon!), but when i first heard it in a hotel room a few months back, all i could think was how to get it, no matter the cost and am extremely happy to have it.Can't figure out why Bose does not make them anymore....By the way, I own 3 more Bluetooth speakers, all great, unbelievable value for the money, but this little Bose is worth every cent and it beats them all in terms of quality and convenience.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars This speaker is so good that I had to order one for myself

content: My boyfriend ordered one of these speakers and had it sent to our house because they would not ship to Puerto Rico where he is working. title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good sound quality. Balanced sound. Talks too much! At higher volumes the base is reduced.
author: Eric Cram
content: I don't need it to talk every time I turn it on! what a pain in the ass! And the talking volume is set automatically, so it wakes people up. "PAIRED! PAIRING! NOT PAIRED!" Shut up already!Good sound quality. Balanced sound. At higher volumes the base is automatically reduced, so don't expect it to perform twice as well at twice the volume. Artificially weighted to make it feel like it has big magnets (as a speaker manufacturer, I know this trick well.) So don't let the weight make you feel like it's of high quality. Let the sound dictate that. But the quality is good. Much better than my JBL of similar price.I would buy it again, but I know Bose can do better than this.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best bluetooth speaker I have tried...so far
author: PrairiePrankster
content: 3 weeks in the house with these - bedroom, kitchen and porch. Pairs easily and reliably with MacBook Air, iPhone, Dell Windows 10 Pro desktop and Lenovo Win 7 laptop. Sound quality clean, each instrument and voice can be heard clearly, not as spacious as surround sound devices but plenty of bass that was not muddy or boomy. Volume great for small rooms, patios and on the go. Battery life is a pleasant surprise, over 10 hours between charges - will update review if it degrades with time. I have had many other brands of BT speakers and while some sounded pretty good, they had really crappy BT connectivity - 5 minutes fine then the signal drops. It could be that I have better and more modern source devices, but maybe overall BT gear is just getting better with time. Whatever the case, I am very pleased with this purchase, it seems well worth the coin and is great as an auxiliary portable sound system.

content: If you put this in an enclosed space or back against the wall you will get more bass despite not having any ports. I have been purchasing Bose since the 901's came out in the late 70s. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars BOOMING BASS and clear highs with no distortion. Amazing sound to size ratio.
author: mikey mike
content: Ok so I went to Best Buy to hear Sony's XB20, 30, and 40, UE's Boom 2 and Mega Boom and JBL's Charge 3 and Flip 4. and they all sounded ok except the cheapest of each brand had zero bass and the highs were muffled due to the water resistant / proof design of each model listed. I don't care if a speaker can take water or not. I just want it to sound good. Then I listened to the non-waterproof or water resistant Bose SoundLink Mini ll. I wasn't expecting much in terms of bass because it's so small in size. Man was I wrong. This tiny thing is firing from the front and the back like the large Bose's do and the bass is BOOMING and highs are high and clear. Speaker feels like a brick in your hand too in terms of weight. The sound clarity and the depth of sound this thing makes sounds likes its coming out of a speaker 10 times larger than it is. It's truly a Bose speaker. title: 3.0 out of 5 stars A bit pricey, but not bad
author: Arnie
content: So, I'm an old guy, and an old-school semi-audiophile (read 'snob wannabe'). Bought this to take along for a several-month out of state contract job, since hauling my 60's all-tube audio gear, four vintage loudspeakers, turntable, and a bunch of vinyl LP's just wouldn't be practical. In short, this thing is pretty impressive in its volume and frequency response. It accurately reproduces modern digital content in all of its flat, cold, sterile glory, with a fair amount of punch. It paired to my Samsung phone flawlessly; in contrast, I spent over an hour getting it to talk to my Lenovo laptop (I'll blame that on the laptop, since the Bose snuggled right up to the phone). My main reservation is about the price; if you've got a spare couple hundred lying around, sure, but don't make your kids miss any meals for it. To be fair, Bose has always made good products; my old 301 Series II's are still favorites, especially for small-group jazz and such, and the Wave radios I've heard have been really strong. So, I'd recommend this thing for bedroom, office, or hotel-room use, background music at the pool, and so on, with a question mark (or exclamation point) hovering over the price tag.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound from a Small Package
author: Jeffrey A. Fussell
content: Bose lives up to it's reputation with well-balanced sound across the spectrum from a surprisingly small enclosure. Bass response sounds natural and has none of the over-augmented low end often used with inferior products. Volume is more than adequate for general entertainment and can be clearly heard in a large room. We noticed some issues in maintain the Bluetooth connection if the phone gets too far from the speaker. I can't say this is an actual problem with the speaker or it is normal for Bluetooth (not an expert here). However, keeping the phone within 20 feet of the speaker is not an issue and it works well. We keep the speaker on the cradle and it stays in one place, so we cannot speak to battery life or portability.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars A MUST HAVE for music lovers
author: Jenni
content: This speaker was a mother's day gift for my mom. I already own this speaker, she loves to listen to her music, so i figured it would be the perfect gift for her. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite Bluetooth speaker. Hands down.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Nice but not amazing
author: JH
content: The bar for this Bose speaker was set fairly high given the high price tag for such a small speaker. I have no complaints with the sound quality (it is good, though my ear may not be good enough to understanding the wow that other's have expressed). My biggest complaint is the pairing. It does pair with more than one device at a time but it often (normally) gets confused. So this is really only usable if you plan to pair it with a single device. I pair it with my phone. When I take me phone out of the room and it loses contact it gets confused when I return to the room (i.e. it does not simply connect again and off we go).All and all I am not sure it is worth the cost but it does have nice sound quality.

content: The speaker is good, but I feel they do a poor job of describing the size of this thing. Kind of defeats the purpose of a station in my opinion.On top of all that, the speaker isn’t loud enough to be heard over my 1x12 combo tube amp at bedroom volume. It’s asking a lot from such a small Bose speaker, but again, the listing does a poor job of describing the size. title: 1.0 out of 5 stars Don't waste your money. If anything goes wrong Bose has horrible tech support.
author: Hoopy
content: I bought this for work from home to listen to music and also do conference calls. The only nice thing about it is you can connect 2 devices.The charger docking station is poorly designed. You have a 50/50 chance that the speaker will engage the charger every time you dock it.The sound is o.k. but there are no sound control buttons. So, you can't adjust treble/base etc. The buttons on the speaker are rubbery and take effort to depress. The design feel old and outdated.My speaker had charging issues after 2 months while still under warranty. One reason I spent extra money to by Bose was I mistakenly assumed they would have top notch tech support. They do not. Basically, you can try using chat support but you are eventually going to end up calling them which is a hassle. And, they won't send you any email confirmation of the phone call so it's like it never happened.Bottom line is that I had to return the speaker for a warranty repair on June 15. Normally, under warranty the company will replace it with a new one. Instead they are doing a repair. Fine. But now they say the repair will not be done until September 3rd. So, that's is 2.5 months. And, Bose customer support has such limited hours and wait times that it's not worth my time to call them and complain. I wish I had just returned this instead of putting faith in Bose to provide good support.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2020

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars W-KING D320 A Powerhouse of Sound and Visual Delights lasted over 17 hours playing
author: Mike S.
content: The media could not be loaded. 08/23/23 UPDATE. Make sure you get the firmware update first! It will make connecting to and controlling the speaker seamless.I'm a huge fan of W-KING devices and the D320 emerges as a true standout with its fusion of exceptional sound quality and captivating lighting effects. I had some issues with the application BUT it still works great without even running it.The D320 portable speaker combines cutting-edge technology with an attention-grabbing visual spectacle, resulting in an audiovisual experience that is nothing short of captivating. The D320 sets itself apart with its IP67 waterproof rating, portability, customized EQ, deep bass prowess, 40W of sheer power, latest Bluetooth connectivity, and a mesmerizing lightshow.One of the standout features is its rugged durability, marked by its IP67 waterproof certification. This makes it an ideal companion for outdoor adventures, pool parties, and beach outings, ensuring that your music keeps playing regardless of the elements. The speaker's compact and portable design further enhances its utility, allowing you to carry the power of music wherever you go.When it comes to sound quality this speaker produces a room-filling sound that's rich, balanced, and immersive. The customized EQ settings allow you to fine-tune the audio to suit your preferences, whether you're a fan of crisp highs, punchy mids, or thunderous lows. The combination of a dedicated woofer and two tweeters ensures that the sound profile remains well-rounded, delivering deep, resonant bass along with crystal-clear highs that complement each other harmoniously.The cool lightshow is a visual spectacle that dances to the rhythm of your music, transforming any environment into a dynamic, pulsating atmosphere. The lighting effects not only enhance the auditory experience but also create a captivating ambiance that's perfect for parties, gatherings, or even solo jam sessions.The seamless Bluetooth connectivity, featuring the latest technology, ensures that pairing your devices is a breeze. Whether you're streaming from your smartphone, tablet, or laptop, you can enjoy uninterrupted playback with minimal setup hassle. This convenience, combined with the D320's impressive battery life, allows you to keep the music playing for hours on end, without worrying about frequent recharging.In conclusion, Its robust construction, waterproof rating, customizable EQ, deep bass capabilities, and 40W of power make it a versatile companion for both indoor and outdoor occasions.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOUD & crystal clear! W-King products never disappoint!
author: Placeholder
content: I’ve recently bought a stand-up paddleboard and want to be able to take my tunes with me. I researched and researched and researched and was so happy to find this WK portable speaker. We have bought two other beach radios from W-KING and pair them. We love the battery life of these products you can play all day long at a fairly high volume and never run out of battery. You do have to control the lights from the W-KING app, on your phone. These lights are BRIGHT! It took us a minute to figure out how to turn the lights off to save battery. I can’t imagine anyone not being happy with this little speaker, I have no complaints about the function (except I’d prefer a lighter color). The speaker is covered with a type of fabric. At full volume, the sound is still crisp & clear. The BASS on this little guy is powerful! I chose the 40 W speaker because the clarity is just leaps and bounds of higher quality than the less expensive speakers I was looking at. That being said, I’ve read reviews where people traded in their more expensive portable speakers JBL and Sony for the W- king. One review that I read said that this is for “ music people“ we have had other brands of waterproof speakers, but the base was not there so they just sounded very thin. Search no more, you found your perfect portable speaker! I can’t wait to hop on my paddleboard and set sail.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Customer disservice?
author: buddhashenglong
content: For it's size, the D320 has a clear punchy sound. I bought this for it's waterproof rating as a beach and travel speaker. The claimed battery life is ambitious but acceptable, I was getting around seven hours at 60% volume with the lights off.The rubber port seal began to crumble and ultimately fell off, rendering this unit useless to me for it's intended purpose. I contacted “customer service" to get a replacement seal & after many emails they offered an apology & a 10$ discount. Among many BT speakers I have, including two D9-1s, I can't recommend W-King ever again. Now this D320 can stay in the house for podcasts, no more beach life.UPDATEW-King contacted me about this review and offered a full refund. More than I was expecting for sure, and if that happens maybe I will buy a new one. From two to five stars then,thanks Jane.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars THIS IS THE ONE TO BUY
author: Audiojunkie
content: Last month I've bought the soundcore motion 300 the bogasing m5 the jbl flip 6 the jbl charge 5 and just found my keeper in the blue wking d320 . The app with 10 band eq is great the sound and power this thing produces is legit powerful. No distortion just beautiful room filling sound and cannot wait to bring this with ice fishing this winter and to the lake in kayak or paddleboat this summer.. why this over 300 the 300 has worst distortion I've experienced in a speaker with volume at 70 percent or higher and that's without xbass on the m5 great little speaker but not how they have the speakers set up the flip 6 and charge 5 are impressive for bass but where they lack is in instrument separation and detail which is to be expected I guess being mono with only 1 tweeter in each speaker but what really burned me with the jbl as I bought two of the flip 6 is when paired in tws ya cannot actually customize sound in their garbage 3 band eq they keep it locked on flat sound cuz it gives what they say is best sound and that is pure garbage I will say for a bass head the charge 5 on sale is decent at 119 but this d320 is like a mix of those not quite as impressive bass but still very good especially considering the smaller size of this speaker vs something like a tribit blast where it excels is with the instrument separation man does this thing sound good with a Lil love thru their app using 10 band eq... I ain't into the lights but my 10 and 8 and 4 yr olds are so cool feature to have when they have friends over and we r all jamming to some tunes ... haven't gotten to fully test battery life but if it's like the d9 or x10 I'm guessing it will do what they claim as long as it isn't cranked at 100 percent volume and that's the other thing wking speakers always get loud and sound good but they finally did it with this app where not only does it get really really loud but it does so beautifully with zero distortion ... wking ya nailed it with this and can't wait till that x20 is available here in the states I will buy it immediately and this charge 5 is Goin back to target tomorrow

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Upgraded with RBG lights on both ends?
author: john bauer
content: Just a quick review as i test other speakers I've recently purchased.First thing that surprised me was the addition of RGB lights on both ends of the speaker. I watched reviews that made comments of why only one side had lights. Looks like they fixed that.Regarding their new app. Loaded app version 2.0.8. No issues downloading from play store and connecting to speaker. Features a 10 band eq with a optimistic 30hz control. They quote a frequency response down to 100hz but in testing it plays down to 62hz before dropping off.Light controls. Here's where i ran into an issue. Looks like you're supposed to be able to customize the RGB pattern but only can turn off/on and brightness at the moment. There's supposed to be a "mode" button but there isn't.I'll update later with my sound review.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Its okay
author: tyler
content: I have another W-King speaker thats been pretty good to me so I figured I'd give this one a shot. The light show is super annoying, it switches between flashing, spinning, changing color every second that its more distracting than "cool". The only customization in the app is changing the brightness which isn't really customization to me.The speaker also locks up often to the point where I need to press the reset button on the inside of the speaker to get it to respond. This has happened when trying to change the volume, trying to pause music, turning on and off the lights, etc. The annoying part is when it locks up you can't even turn it off and reset it that way. The only way to get it to stop is either wait to see if it frees up itself or hit the reset button. I would prefer the reset button be more easily accessible on future models or even integrated into the power button because finding a thin piece of wire to press that button under the flap isn't ideal in normal use cases.The sound is probably the only redeeming part of the speaker. Its got good range and sounds decent enough. With the annoyances I have with it, I think I would rather spend the extra money and get the JBL product instead.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable with great sound!!
author: Brittany Horrell
content: My son has a JBL pill speaker he uses for his car stereo. I thought this wouldn't be nearly as nice. Other than loudness / volume it's really similar. If you want loud, I would either get another W-King and connect or just buy the next one up in watts. The Spotify tunes sound great and I listen to a lot of progressive music with a lot of intricate passages. I took it for a ride right out of the box, with the charge that was in it. It still lasted the 3 hours that I was out. Fully charged in about 3 hours with brick outlet adaptor. The RGB is a nice touch. I'm 59 and had no idea how to pair a bluetooth device. Asked Google what to do and now I'm a pro. This is the first time I have left a review, because I had a hard time on which one to buy. I got this for $40 on sale - and I think it's a steal Cheers!!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressed for the size, sound quality, bass and clarity!
author: realestatewoman
content: The media could not be loaded. I have been using this speaker off and on for about a week or two and decided it was time to give it a review.I enjoy the size, bass, and loudness/clarity it produces for such a compact sized speaker!Other similarly sized speakers I have bought in the past are not near as loud or clear and they get kind of a "fuzzy" sound when played wide open.In the video I shared I tried to play a song wide open just to share the quality and you could tell it never sounded "fuzzy".In addition I shared a sample of a Joe Rogan podcast that showed it is clear and easy to understand on max volume.I am looking forward to taking it out on the water kayaking with me and testing it more because it is waterproof!So far I have really enjoyed it working around my garage and really recommend it if you want a nice high quality compact sized quality speaker!I typically only turn the volume halfway to 75% cranked up and it's plenty loud for me and my needs!I also have to give W-King a shout out for standing by their customers and warrantying a previous extra large speaker I use for basketball I bought from them a year ago.One of the speakers went out in my extra large basketball speaker which is a completely different model than this one and they sent me a new one free of charge, and covered shipping cost, so they do take care of their customers if you have any issues!If you are on the fence about a high quality compact speaker I would not hesitate to buy this one! 👍Thanks again W-King for an amazing product and you have a loyal customer for life!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars W-KING D320 A Powerhouse of Sound and Visual Delights lasted over 17 hours playing
author: Mike S.
content: The media could not be loaded. 08/23/23 UPDATE. Make sure you get the firmware update first! It will make connecting to and controlling the speaker seamless.I'm a huge fan of W-KING devices and the D320 emerges as a true standout with its fusion of exceptional sound quality and captivating lighting effects. I had some issues with the application BUT it still works great without even running it.The D320 portable speaker combines cutting-edge technology with an attention-grabbing visual spectacle, resulting in an audiovisual experience that is nothing short of captivating. The D320 sets itself apart with its IP67 waterproof rating, portability, customized EQ, deep bass prowess, 40W of sheer power, latest Bluetooth connectivity, and a mesmerizing lightshow.One of the standout features is its rugged durability, marked by its IP67 waterproof certification. This makes it an ideal companion for outdoor adventures, pool parties, and beach outings, ensuring that your music keeps playing regardless of the elements. The speaker's compact and portable design further enhances its utility, allowing you to carry the power of music wherever you go.When it comes to sound quality this speaker produces a room-filling sound that's rich, balanced, and immersive. The customized EQ settings allow you to fine-tune the audio to suit your preferences, whether you're a fan of crisp highs, punchy mids, or thunderous lows. The combination of a dedicated woofer and two tweeters ensures that the sound profile remains well-rounded, delivering deep, resonant bass along with crystal-clear highs that complement each other harmoniously.The cool lightshow is a visual spectacle that dances to the rhythm of your music, transforming any environment into a dynamic, pulsating atmosphere. The lighting effects not only enhance the auditory experience but also create a captivating ambiance that's perfect for parties, gatherings, or even solo jam sessions.The seamless Bluetooth connectivity, featuring the latest technology, ensures that pairing your devices is a breeze. Whether you're streaming from your smartphone, tablet, or laptop, you can enjoy uninterrupted playback with minimal setup hassle. This convenience, combined with the D320's impressive battery life, allows you to keep the music playing for hours on end, without worrying about frequent recharging.In conclusion, Its robust construction, waterproof rating, customizable EQ, deep bass capabilities, and 40W of power make it a versatile companion for both indoor and outdoor occasions.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOUD & crystal clear! W-King products never disappoint!
author: Placeholder
content: I’ve recently bought a stand-up paddleboard and want to be able to take my tunes with me. I researched and researched and researched and was so happy to find this WK portable speaker. We have bought two other beach radios from W-KING and pair them. We love the battery life of these products you can play all day long at a fairly high volume and never run out of battery. You do have to control the lights from the W-KING app, on your phone. These lights are BRIGHT! It took us a minute to figure out how to turn the lights off to save battery. I can’t imagine anyone not being happy with this little speaker, I have no complaints about the function (except I’d prefer a lighter color). The speaker is covered with a type of fabric. At full volume, the sound is still crisp & clear. The BASS on this little guy is powerful! I chose the 40 W speaker because the clarity is just leaps and bounds of higher quality than the less expensive speakers I was looking at. That being said, I’ve read reviews where people traded in their more expensive portable speakers JBL and Sony for the W- king. One review that I read said that this is for “ music people“ we have had other brands of waterproof speakers, but the base was not there so they just sounded very thin. Search no more, you found your perfect portable speaker! I can’t wait to hop on my paddleboard and set sail.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Customer disservice?
author: buddhashenglong
content: For it's size, the D320 has a clear punchy sound. I bought this for it's waterproof rating as a beach and travel speaker. The claimed battery life is ambitious but acceptable, I was getting around seven hours at 60% volume with the lights off.The rubber port seal began to crumble and ultimately fell off, rendering this unit useless to me for it's intended purpose. I contacted “customer service" to get a replacement seal & after many emails they offered an apology & a 10$ discount. Among many BT speakers I have, including two D9-1s, I can't recommend W-King ever again. Now this D320 can stay in the house for podcasts, no more beach life.UPDATEW-King contacted me about this review and offered a full refund. More than I was expecting for sure, and if that happens maybe I will buy a new one. From two to five stars then,thanks Jane.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars THIS IS THE ONE TO BUY
author: Audiojunkie
content: Last month I've bought the soundcore motion 300 the bogasing m5 the jbl flip 6 the jbl charge 5 and just found my keeper in the blue wking d320 . The app with 10 band eq is great the sound and power this thing produces is legit powerful. No distortion just beautiful room filling sound and cannot wait to bring this with ice fishing this winter and to the lake in kayak or paddleboat this summer.. why this over 300 the 300 has worst distortion I've experienced in a speaker with volume at 70 percent or higher and that's without xbass on the m5 great little speaker but not how they have the speakers set up the flip 6 and charge 5 are impressive for bass but where they lack is in instrument separation and detail which is to be expected I guess being mono with only 1 tweeter in each speaker but what really burned me with the jbl as I bought two of the flip 6 is when paired in tws ya cannot actually customize sound in their garbage 3 band eq they keep it locked on flat sound cuz it gives what they say is best sound and that is pure garbage I will say for a bass head the charge 5 on sale is decent at 119 but this d320 is like a mix of those not quite as impressive bass but still very good especially considering the smaller size of this speaker vs something like a tribit blast where it excels is with the instrument separation man does this thing sound good with a Lil love thru their app using 10 band eq... I ain't into the lights but my 10 and 8 and 4 yr olds are so cool feature to have when they have friends over and we r all jamming to some tunes ... haven't gotten to fully test battery life but if it's like the d9 or x10 I'm guessing it will do what they claim as long as it isn't cranked at 100 percent volume and that's the other thing wking speakers always get loud and sound good but they finally did it with this app where not only does it get really really loud but it does so beautifully with zero distortion ... wking ya nailed it with this and can't wait till that x20 is available here in the states I will buy it immediately and this charge 5 is Goin back to target tomorrow

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Upgraded with RBG lights on both ends?
author: john bauer
content: Just a quick review as i test other speakers I've recently purchased.First thing that surprised me was the addition of RGB lights on both ends of the speaker. I watched reviews that made comments of why only one side had lights. Looks like they fixed that.Regarding their new app. Loaded app version 2.0.8. No issues downloading from play store and connecting to speaker. Features a 10 band eq with a optimistic 30hz control. They quote a frequency response down to 100hz but in testing it plays down to 62hz before dropping off.Light controls. Here's where i ran into an issue. Looks like you're supposed to be able to customize the RGB pattern but only can turn off/on and brightness at the moment. There's supposed to be a "mode" button but there isn't.I'll update later with my sound review.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Its okay
author: tyler
content: I have another W-King speaker thats been pretty good to me so I figured I'd give this one a shot. The light show is super annoying, it switches between flashing, spinning, changing color every second that its more distracting than "cool". The only customization in the app is changing the brightness which isn't really customization to me.The speaker also locks up often to the point where I need to press the reset button on the inside of the speaker to get it to respond. This has happened when trying to change the volume, trying to pause music, turning on and off the lights, etc. The annoying part is when it locks up you can't even turn it off and reset it that way. The only way to get it to stop is either wait to see if it frees up itself or hit the reset button. I would prefer the reset button be more easily accessible on future models or even integrated into the power button because finding a thin piece of wire to press that button under the flap isn't ideal in normal use cases.The sound is probably the only redeeming part of the speaker. Its got good range and sounds decent enough. With the annoyances I have with it, I think I would rather spend the extra money and get the JBL product instead.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Affordable with great sound!!

content: My son has a JBL pill speaker he uses for his car stereo. I thought this wouldn't be nearly as nice. Other than loudness / volume it's really similar. If you want loud, I would either get another W-King and connect or just buy the next one up in watts. The Spotify tunes sound great and I listen to a lot of progressive music with a lot of intricate passages. I took it for a ride right out of the box, with the charge that was in it. It still lasted the 3 hours that I was out. Fully charged in about 3 hours with brick outlet adaptor. The RGB is a nice touch. I'm 59 and had no idea how to pair a bluetooth device. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Impressed for the size, sound quality, bass and clarity!
author: realestatewoman
content: The media could not be loaded. I have been using this speaker off and on for about a week or two and decided it was time to give it a review.I enjoy the size, bass, and loudness/clarity it produces for such a compact sized speaker!Other similarly sized speakers I have bought in the past are not near as loud or clear and they get kind of a "fuzzy" sound when played wide open.In the video I shared I tried to play a song wide open just to share the quality and you could tell it never sounded "fuzzy".In addition I shared a sample of a Joe Rogan podcast that showed it is clear and easy to understand on max volume.I am looking forward to taking it out on the water kayaking with me and testing it more because it is waterproof!So far I have really enjoyed it working around my garage and really recommend it if you want a nice high quality compact sized quality speaker!I typically only turn the volume halfway to 75% cranked up and it's plenty loud for me and my needs!I also have to give W-King a shout out for standing by their customers and warrantying a previous extra large speaker I use for basketball I bought from them a year ago.One of the speakers went out in my extra large basketball speaker which is a completely different model than this one and they sent me a new one free of charge, and covered shipping cost, so they do take care of their customers if you have any issues!If you are on the fence about a high quality compact speaker I would not hesitate to buy this one! 👍Thanks again W-King for an amazing product and you have a loyal customer for life!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tribit Stormbox Blast
author: BLRG
content: Arrived yesterday and connected it straight away. Had 60% charge on arrival and excellent packaging. Sound blows away the Soundcore Motion Boom + (in my opinion) which I tried first but was just not able to get the deeper bass and despite watching all the videos and reviews and eq recommendations was not able to get the deep bass or anything close to the Tribit also was not able to reduce the screechy highs on the MB+. My son has the HK Onyx studio 6 and when comparing the MB+ to the studio 6 the only area the MB+ wins is it gets louder but the sound is no where near the shear richness or quality of the Studio 6. This Tribit has the deep bass and smooth richness but can also get loud and also sounds great on lower volumes as well - normally listen at 30%-40%. We are using it as a sound bar for our TV right now and watched a couple movies last night. WOW what a difference. Was like being at the cinema - the rumble on the lows! The bluetooth is easy to connect and only small issue is delay when flipping between tv, phone & laptop bluetooth. Was flipping between multiple devices simultaneously, Was testing with youtube videos from the laptop, movies on TV and music from my phone as well as playing with the tribit app & settings. I think it is only supposed to connect to two devices at a time but irrespective it was only slight delay flipping between 3 devices - between 2-3 seconds. The sound and deep bass is so good for its size and I know many talk of it being heavy but its not heavy to me, feels right and solid - not cheap -but quality. It is super easy to carry around and will be great for the boat / lake and beach. It is warm and rich sounding with plenty of customization. Will see how the battery does over time and how it keeps performing but so far very impressed. Started the morning with the battery at 100% and shows on the app. As soon as the light on the unit showed it was filly charged the app said 100%. Lights on it are bright- nice to have but I keep them turned off. Nice thing is they still show when adjusting the volume even when light display is off. Have had it on today non-stop for 12 hours so far playing between 40 - 60% volume - lights off - working as a TV sound bar and for streaming music. I am still showing 60%. Will see how long it keeps going.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Sound
author: Ryan Nobles-Fisher
content: Was considering this or the JBL equivalent, but after trying this product for a few weeks I am more than happy. I was a little worried about trying a non-name-brand speaker, but after consulting some forums, I took a chance. The sound is juicy and has good bass. I downloaded the updated sound enhancements and am very happy with it. The battery lasts a lot longer than you'd expect and is quite loud. I usually keep it around half volume and works great both indoor and outdoor. Its got some heft, but the quality of the construction feels solid and I love the boom-box aesthetic. For the price, you cant beat this.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unbeatable price/performance! Has 3.5 mm aux input!
author: Corndog
content: Sure, it's a bit weighty, but I'd rather that and have nice, beefy sound, than to have it be light and have a less substantial sound. But you may differ. If you are one of those people, you may prefer the Motion Boom Plus by Soundcore. I got a chance to test out both in person, and personally, like many, I went with the Blast.The Motion Boom Plus can be tuned for an elegant sound, but its limited EQ in the app kills what could be much better. I was able to get richer, lower reaching bass out of it using a 3rd party app, but it took much work what was existent out off the box with the Blast - and much more substantial at that! The retro-looking RGB side lights are icing on the cake. Very cool to look at, and adds a unique effect.As for sound, I usually opt for flat, neutral tunes when it comes to my monitors and headphones, but I wanted a fun, boomy "travel" speaker (more like 'road-trip speaker) that was competent with the bass. Not only is it clean and punchy, it can reach down surprisingly low for such small drivers. The mids and highs are nothing to write home about, but they aren't terrible. They're serviceable. Mids are a bit recessed, dry, and resist drastic tuning, but can be slightly brightened to bring the tracks alive. Could be better, but not bad, and doesn't ruin the sound of the speaker. I'll also add here that I wouldn't have purchased this speaker if it did not have the 3.5 mm aux input, so good on Tribit for including that.Battery life is also phenomenal, but prepare to lose just a tiny bit in the power of the sound when unplugged. I honestly prefer that approach, as I value sound quality over portability. If it's relatively close while on battery, but gets a nice boost plugged in, hooray for that! In the end, I suppose it's how you look at it; lose power when unplugged for portability vs get a boost when plugged in - I see it the second way because I'm used to the philosophy that there is always a sacrifice for portability.Right now the Stormbox Blast is priced 40% off its original price at $155.98. That's awesome, especially when you consider that the less capable, yet lighter Motion Boom Plus is price $5 more. It's really going to come down to your preferences and personal needs. But if it's for a more powerful sound, a flashier look and presence, then this one is going to be it in this price range.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2023

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great initial quality
author: SuperBlindGirl
content: Writing this review from one blind person's perspective.I have purchased other Tribit speakers, namely the storm box. I was very happy with it, so when I wanted some thing bigger and louder for outdoors, I gravitated toward this blast. Based on my experience with the storm box, which is a smaller less powerful speaker, I was hoping the blast would afford the same features. There were some similarities, but some drawbacks as well. It is not a larger version of the storm box. It does have somewhat of a similar feel, same shape only larger, but sports a handle on the top as it is much heavier than I would have expected. I assume this is due to the significantly larger battery which allows for long playtime, lighting, and the ability to charge other devices from the speaker. Well it is noticeably heavy, it is not overwhelmingly heavy. Unlike the storm box, do not expect 360° sound from this speaker. It only projects forward. What I liked about the storm box were large easy to find volume and play pause buttons. The buttons to control the speaker are on the top in front of the handle in a row. While they do have some tactile markings, they are not as pronounced as the storm box, and are much smaller buttons. They can easily blend together. I would have liked to see bigger and better marked buttons considering the large size of this speaker. Similarly to the storm box, the controls only allow for volume up and down and play pause. There are not controls to skip tracks or fast forward. I really would like to see this feature added to their line of products as it would be extremely helpful, so is one drawback to the brand. One cool thing is that you can download the Tribit app, which I did on my iPhone, and this allows for full control of the speaker, including lights, equalizer, and volume controls. I have been using the speaker outside, and I think that is where it excels. It definitely sounds good inside, but definitely seems made for the outdoors. I appreciate that it is water resistant, and it has decently deep base which I also appreciate. The lighting has two different modes, which with my extremely low vision I can barely make out but I'm sure keep things interesting for those who can see. You can control the lights either from the app or using the button on the speaker itself. You can also turn on and off the base boost on the speaker itself or in the app. There are more equalizer options within the app . I don't have much of a very discerning ear I guess, because I have a hard time distinguishing between the difference of bass boost and party modes, but the sound quality is good. The biggest and best surprise for me was that when I used Bluetooth to connect this speaker to my iPhone to play music, the music played on the speaker, but voiceover was only coming out of my phone. I actually love this because it allows me to control the music from my phone accessibly but not interrupt the music. I wish every speaker would do this! my storm box speakers don't seem to have this functionality and I have not experienced it with any other brands of speakers. This made me very happy! I was able to purchase the speaker on sale, which made the price tag a lot more palatable. So my recommendation would be to watch for that! it is definitely overall a solid speaker and worth checking out, especially if you have vision issues.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unbelievable Deal!
author: Chad Czternastek
content: The media could not be loaded. I budgeted $210 to buy this in a month or two. I seen it on Amazon for $150 and I jumped on the deal. My friend has one so I heard the sound that comes from the speakers. The sub-woofers are built into the flanking sides. It hurts to touch it when you got bass going on.The sound that comes out the speakers is so good. So crisp, so clean, just as good as a Bose if not better. Unless you are one of those who want the expensive, hi-fidelity stuff, these will more than do.Some people complain about the weight but I think it builds into a big space of speakers into a dense set of small speakers combining into 90W. It weighs 12 pounds which don't seem like a lot but you initially expect it to be lighter, and you instantly realize all the weight is the dense design. Only issue I could complain about, if I had to find one, is the battery life. The ads and descriptions say it has so many hours, and they figure that time at super low settings. When you use this at the ideal volume, you are not going to get as much as you think. As I said, if I had to complain it would be that. For me, I listen to music on it, and lasts me two to three days. That's a couple hours, a few there. But if you have it plugged in, you have no worries. 8-10 hours total I would say is realistic.If you get this and like to listen to remastered music, which seems to be the accepted way to cash in on a already successful record. You can tell cause the music quality is top tier. You hear the little things that you don't normally hear. I think listening to the sound, you need to use the pre-set equalizer settings based on the music type. I have no clue on how to use an equalizer but using the pre-set ones you can tell when switching.What makes this so great is how music is bought now compared to a decade and beyond. Used to be you hear a couple songs off an album, you go pay $20 for the record. Now, you pay $10 to Amazon Music or Spotify and you have almost full access to any album, ever. You can discover new music on this. The quality is good enough to invest more time into the great art of music. I've read you can have more then one connected at the same time.Best value of anything I ever got. This is so worth it at retail price but you can usually catch it for $199 or less if you look or find the right deal. I've had a set of speakers well over $500 total that don't sound as good as this. If you are thinking about investing in some speakers, and stream from Bluetooth, I can save you time. Of course if you are looking to get very high quality speakers, and higher level of wattage and thump, you are gonna pay more but this does the job.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 17, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars outstanding sound quality
author: damon
content: I really appreciate the reviews I came across that recommended this - they were absolutely spot on! I have several different portable/ bluetooth speakers to compare this to, new and older - and it is very impressive. Originally I was trying to replace an older Altec Lansing speaker that the speakers finally gave up, and my wife was looking to upgrade from a little Oontz Angle 3. After looking into the different options, we ended up trying/ getting a few (all of which exceeded the old Altec and the tiny Angle 3).The Bugani Shock is smaller, lighter & much cheaper than the Tribit - it sounds good for its size, can get pretty loud and stays clear, but its not in the same league by a large margin. I had tried the W-King D-10 - its bigger than the Bugani, but smaller & lighter than the Tribit - and priced in the middle of them as well. Again, it sounds good, gets loud, stays clear, had much more bass and had a bigger overall sound stage than the Bugani - but still not on the same scale as this Tribit. I recently got the Klipsch Groove XXL - and sound quality wise, they are extremely close - maybe the Klipsch having a little more detail, the Tribit has a bit more bass - but both have unreal scale, especially for being relatively small, portable speakers. How much bass the Tribit puts out is really impressive for its size - all while having a very balanced overall sound.I havent found out the limit of the battery life yet - but I have played it at around 60-80% volume for several hours continuously w/ no problems.We ended up getting a 2nd Tribit recently when they were on sale - I tried them together in stereo - they work seamlessly and sounds that much better.I could easily give a recommendation for either the Tribit or Klipsch - they're similar size, the Tribit is a little heavier but has a better handle... Finding each on sale - the Tribit is around $20 cheaper... The Klipsch has a remote... I couldnt find any waterproof/ resistance rating for the Klipsch, while the Tribit is IPX7 rated, etc.... I dont believe a better option is available at this time for a speaker under $200 - I did my best to find it.
