title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Full, LOUD Sound Even in Open Spaces
author: Teknogk
content: I have been eying up the JBL BOOMBOX 3 for a while since I love my Charge 4 but I wanted something that filled the yard with sound and carried good bass. The Boombox 3 seemed to be the ticket but man, that price is high.I stumbled onto a review for this Tribit StormBox on YouTube from German guy who had these two side by side on an open basketball court while his son was zooming around a few RC cars. He switched between these two testing the volume, bass, using different music and the difference was remarkable. Unfortunately that video has disappeared but I was impressed enough to look into this and give it a try and when I saw this had a $40 coupon bringing it to $160 I jumped. I was not disappointed!The sound is great, the battery is phenomenal (without running the LEDs and at about 50-75% volume), and a few people who have heard it were very impressed. I had three long 6-8 hours days in the yard and each night forgot to take it in when I only had one and charge it and on the 4th day I thought I might be in trouble lasting all day but checked the app and it still had 40% charge!I loved it so much I purchased a second one so I could run them in stereo mode as a left and right speaker! It also works in 'serial' mode so both speakers are connected and both playing the same music in stereo if they are spread apart too far to have a left and right speaker.UPDATE!!! I thought is was able to play in 'serial' mode which the speaker said it was in but it is still only left and right when connected. I didn't really notice it with the music I was playing but caught on after some music with more separation. I reached out to Tribit on this and they said it only paired in stereo mode but not at all a deal breaker but it would be nice to have this feature.The nice touch for using them together is that once linked they remember the mode you are connected in (stereo or serial) so when you turn them on they link together again automatically. The volume of both is controlled by my phone so they both go up and down with the one control and if you turn one off when connected the other powers down as well. The only slightly negative things I have with this is sometimes if my phone is on me in my pocket and I am working at a lower level in the yard behind a retaining wall the Bluetooth can get a little spotty but works fine when I leave the yard and go in the house and even stays connected if I go into the front yard.The other thing I would like to see is some sort of visual indicator of the battery life on the speaker itself, maybe adding that as an option when cycling the LED modes. As of now I need to open the app to check the battery.The app is only OK but getting better as I have had a 3-4 updates to it since my first one was ordered in March.Beyond that I really could not be happier with this purchase and I have two of them new ($320 with a $40 coupon for each and STILL currently available as of 7/31/24) for significantly less than a single JBL Boombox 3 new ($500) or 'renewed' ($375).I am no super geek audiophile but to me and many others that have heard this it sounds great to us and really fills the yard with sound and good bass so I highly recommend this speaker!
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars My review vs soundcore boom 2 plus
author: John
content: So quickly going over the differencesThe weight. The soundcore isn't light, but the tribit is noticeably heavierAppearance. I personally like the soundcore. For both I don't like the lights. I'm sure they drain battery and I just don't care for them.Sound. To me, out of the box, the soundcore just sounds downright bad. I immediately wanted to return it upon hearing it. That's actually why I bought the tribit, yeah it sounds that bad. The tribit took a few days to arrive and during that time I played with the soundcore. I found some random guys eq and it made things definitely better. The soundcore is a lot newer and I didn't find many eq online.... Or maybe I just don't know where to find them. I'm posting mine that I'm slowly tweaking, but sounds a million times better than what it comes with. I have no idea why soundcore launched what that preset. As for the tribit it sounds much better right out of the box with stock preset. So if you hear comparison videos online like I did, the tribit is just going to sound better, hands down, but doesn't have a ton of room to get better (from my experience)From here I'm comparing using my posted eq for soundcore b2+ and Alan Ross eq for tribit. Keep in mind I'm no audiophile nor do I know the terminology that well.The sound is pretty similar. What jumps or to me is that in things like rock music, the soundcore has like this noise. I'm not sure if muddy is the word, but it sounds like some sounds can just run together, doesn't sound super clean. It doesn't sound awful, just switching back and forth with the tribit, it's noticable. The tribit on the other hand just doesn't have that... It's like it's just not there, it's cleaner. But when listening to volume around 60%+ I can hear the tribit distorting, which doesn't happen on the soundcore.On louder volumes, that muddy or whatever sound on the soundcore kinda makes it feel full, kinda like a concert or something. When the tribit is turned all the way up, I mean it doesn't sound bad, but it sounds a little more empty. It's hard to explain, but that's all I can do. I don't know if it is, but it makes the soundcore sound a lot louder. It's more fun to sing along to at high volumes(drowns out my own voice more lol)My suggestion is if this is for outdoor use/you wanna jam out at high volume and sing along to, get the soundcore. If you want cleaner music for lower volumes especially inside, get the tribit.The both pump it crazy amounts of bass. Since I'm using mine virtually 100% outdoor, the soundcore is what I'm keeping
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Heavy, and no phone calls, but music is great
author: Dman
content: I struggled between getting this Tribit Stormbox, or the W-King 80w, for months. I got this tribit instead of the W, since I have had and still have 4 or 5 ? Tribit devices (from earbuds to Stormbox Micro 2), and their sound is always good, they dont lie about how long their devices will play for, they dont lie about bass, their usb ports have NEVER gone out on me because they were loose or cheaply made/applied, and their tech support is as good as Anker is (top 2 support companies on Amazon says me and many others), and also the Tribit was 10w louder, lol.Anyway, the 1st thing I did with this was charge it, 2nd was play music on it.Most of my music I have is mids/high type, and this didnt disappoint me much about a softer bass. BUT, for those musicians who I do like with lots of bass, I was thinking: man, this is kinda low bass. THEN I remembered there was a Bass Boost button! And man, when you hit that thing, it is perfect (to my ears, and for no$5k setup mind you). The Bass Boost REALLY does boost the bass, without drowning out the mids and highs. Dont ask me how the do it, but they do.The wireless reaction time from my phone is instantaneous on this boombox (unlike the micro 2, which has about a .5 second delay).I have been trying to get my computer speakers to work on my tv because there isnt any bass since the speaker bar wireless bass/rears went out, so I hooked this Tribit boombox to my TV ! LOL Funny thing is, is that it actually works, even though I still have the speaker bar hooked into my tv. It takes a few minutes to get the speaker bar and the Tribit to sound evenly (since I have the Tribit next to my bed between my tv with speaker bars and the Tribit acting as bass and Left Rear, lol), but once it does man does it sound good. There is a little delay when my tv is paired with the Tribit, but I know its from me having an old tv, with wireless 3.x or 4.0 max, and also with 2 sound bars hooked up to it (man I wish my 1st sound bar bass/rear didnt go out on me. I cant afford another $700 to $1100 for just a sound bar bass and rear).Anyway, this Tribit is 'almost' what I was looking for, so here comes the Negs/Wishes.]There is NO Remote control. Why not? Because we should be able to stand up every time we change the channel, or the next song is blaringly loud, or too soft, or we actually want to have a conversation with someone next to us and its too loud? Very big missed chance here, assuming we will just use our phones to sound up/down? You have to find the right loudness on both the Tribit and the whatever-it-is you are doing on the phone to have to turn it up/down also? What about when we are on a call, and cant turn the Tribit off, higher or lower? Oh, just turn your music off from the phone you are talking on! Right.......When I turn the Tribit lights off, I dont want to have to turn them off EVERY time I adjust the volume on it. Big mistake having the lights tuned to the Tribit sound up/down (when you physically have to get up, go to the Tribit box, find the sound button, turn it up or down, go back to where you were and see if it is loud enough or not, and keep doing that all day/night long? What about when you arent using your phone, and have music on a usb thumb drive? Way too many scenarios where a remote control would have upped this a star. No way. Another reason why a remote is good in these situations. On, Off, Up, Down sound, turn lights off completely (heck, put a light bar on the remote, so we can see if it is topping out or not), Last song, Next song. Not much to ask for, right? A remote control goes a LONG way on a limited product like this.Did I say this thing is heavy? It really is. I had an older product like this, with more features, that weighed 1/2 or less than this Tribit. A carrying strap would have been nice! Or a bag? Or something, even rubber handle over the plastic would make hauling this around much nicer.Did I say Limited? Yes, I did. This tribit does 2 things, play music from app and lights. Thats it. No Radio (I know, only us old folk listen to the radio). No cd player. No Time/Day/Date etc (would be nice to be able to use this as an Alarm clock. USB port for thumb drives? Port for sd/micro sdhc cards?Power bank? What device is NOT more portable for a power bank? Or even less pricey? I have a 5 hour bank charger I got for $30 that will power my phone longer than this thing when it is not plugged in, lol. Although, I did say they never lie about their products run time, and 30 hours IS a long time, so maybe a power bank is ok, except most of us have our phones in our hands, on a 1/4 pound or less charger if need be, not laying next to a digital dj, heh. Seems this was just one of those Checkbox 'features' because there arent any features (mostly because that would require a remote control for? maybe).AUX In? Hello, phones dont have a 3.5mm port anymore. Or are we supposed to tie ourselves to the Tribit, yet again, and carry a 3.5mm to usb-c cable around? Maybe we could put it in the Tribit carry bag...Oh, wait, there isnt one. Heh.Overall, for what I use it for, its almost perfect. And it seems W-K is going down this road now also with their new lineup (I was choosing between this and the squared W-K back before the new sleeker W-K came out). Except for a remote control, just to turn up or lower volume, and turn it on off (basically a remote that has the buttons on top of the Stormbox, this thing is almost perfect for me, except when I have to lug it somewhere else in the room. Tribit does 2 things VERY well, and those are Sound quality which this has, and real Time mentioned on how long it runs, which is usually on the lower side rather than the higher side. And Tech Support, so 3 things. I havent needed support for this Stormbox, so its 2 for now.Recommended?Yes. If you are strong enough to lug this thing around, just want to play great sounding music outside while you sit, or do yardwork, or have lots of parties. Oh, also if you want to use it for your tv speakers instead of the tinny sounding wimpy ones that come with tv's nowadays, lol.I almost gave it 5 stars, it is that good, but w/o a remote control and very limited use, I just cant give it a 5.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars A MOVIE THEATER SPEAKER to have at home.
author: Terry Wilkerson, Jr.
content: The media could not be loaded. The packaging and the expedient of the arrival of my speaker arrived on time and were in great condition. I wasn't expecting all of the box and foam that came inside this to keep it well protected. I love that.Now, this is my second introduction to Tribit and I really love this company and this speaker specifically I really, really love beyond infinity. I wish I could give this speaker more than 5 stars because this is amazing.I had my first Tribit StormBox Blast delivered on June 23 for my personal testing since I mostly use the speakers I have (Tribit and JBL) for movies and very little for music and the second one I got on June 30 this year (2024). Let me tell you that the performance of just 1 Tribit StormBox Blast is out of this world. When I was testing my speaker inside of my house at 50% volume within ear shot, oh my God. This speaker is a literal movie theater speaker and that is mostly because of the XBass button on the top of it and even without it on it still gives off that impression. I was testing the Alien: Romulus teaser trailer since that is the best option to use and when I went to the theaters a month before I got this speaker, I remembered the sound and everything when they showed the preview for it and it sounds exactly like the theatrical experience. I am not exaggerating when this speaker was literally shaking my room, with or without my door closed and that I could feel the wind from it. I do not believe it is advertised as a movie theater speaker but it is indeed that. Amazing job Tribit. I suppose that the size of the speaker is why it able to do that but I digress.I love bright colors and the appearance of the LED lights I love and this speaker is very easy to use. As you can see, I have put a video of my 1st speaker at the time and the connectivity of this speaker is 150 feet and I could hear the music and dialog from movies from that far away as if you were a little bit closer to it. It does start cutting out when you are pass the 150 ft. mark but if you have your phone connected to it, I suggest leaving it by the speaker and go the distance you want to go. I had to be at least 200 ft plus and I could hear everything very clearly and I had the speaker at max volume in order for that to work and the phone in the idea I mentioned. It really makes up the size for this speaker and the speaker is 12 pounds but is not heavy to me at all.I test and watch only movies with my speakers and now I have a second one of this speaker and I love it. Godzilla Minus One I tested when I watched the movie for the first time and yeah this is a movie theater speaker and I didn't see that movie in theaters but I know that is what that sounds like. Transformers 2007 I remember every sound when I saw that in theaters and that is exactly how it sounds and even more so. This speaker cost $200 but here on Amazon you can get a 40% discount and it bumps it to $160 to $170 depending on your shipping prefence. This is the best speaker I have ever gotten and do not intend on getting any other speaker. This speaker does have 30 hours of battery life as advertised but it is mostly due to the LED lights being shut off. With the lights it 24 hours or almost less. I watched three 2 hour movies and the Tribit app, in which you can customize the volume for this speaker, the battery was still at 70% or 50% left and that was with the lights and not plugged in. This is the best speaker I have ever purchased and have and I would highly recommend it. Especially if you love movies like me or if you really love music like me also. I wish there was more to elaborate on but this speaker is a BEAST.
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2024

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sounds Like A $500 JBL Boombox, Can't Be Used In The Shower
author: Chase
content: TLDR: Loud as hell, sounds great, plastics feel cheap, not so good at low volume, cannot handle prolonged splashes and sprays. Buy if you want something loud and cheap, don't buy for your shower or outdoor adventures.I bought this speaker due to its high rankings among various reviewers, and am blown away by the sound quality for a speaker around 1/3 the price of its closest competitor (the JBL Boombox series).My friends and I did a side-by-side sound test of the Tribit Stormbox Blast vs a JBL Boombox 2 and found them to be nearly indistinguishable at high volume. Both speakers play loud enough to be uncomfortable for extended indoor use and experience no noticeable distortion or clipping at maximum volume. Default EQ settings of the Tribit vs the JBL are different but both speakers allow for enough customization to suit most users' needs.To sound that good for 1/3 the cost, however, some cuts did have to be made. The two most noticeable are the build quality of the speaker and its low-volume performance. The Tribit speaker is heavy and feels as bulky as it sounds, but is constructed out of cheap-feeling plastic compared to the "luxurious" fabric and rubber overwrap on the JBL Boombox. This makes the speaker easier to dry, put stickers on, or attach third-party mounts to but does look and feel cheap.Low-volume performance is also significantly worse than that of the JBL, mostly due to the Tribit only having 16 volume levels. The gaps between them at low volumes are HUGE compared to those on smaller speakers (think five or six levels on something you could fit in your hand) and I personally find many situations where the only volume options are too quiet or too loud for low-volume use. This can be combatted by disabling Bluetooth absolute volume on your source device or using a source which does not support absolute volume (AUX input or older Bluetooth device). Both the Tribit and the JBL sound less clear and refined at lower volume than most smaller speakers, this is not a design flaw but rather an inherent property of speaker sizing.Another major drawback of the Tribit speaker compared to its more expensive competitors is its poor water resistance. The speaker is rated at IPX7 and can be submerged in water for short periods of time but will malfunction if exposed to splashes or spray for an extended period of time (use outdoors in the rain, inside a shower enclosure, etc). This malfunction usually involves the speaker quickly increasing to maximum volume while the controls fail to respond to inputs and appears to be caused by the use of a paper-based adhesive gasket to secure the control panel's rubber insert into the speaker body. For my use case this is a HUGE drawback but is something I am willing to deal with given the speaker's incredible performance as a high-volume boombox.Other aspects of the speaker mostly work as advertised. I have used the app to update firmware and it has worked without issue. Stereo mode works as well, with no apparent audio delay and full synchronization of the controls and lighting between the speakers. The lack of aptX support for a device with Bluetooth 5.3 hardware is quite unusual but I cannot hear a difference in audio quality, at least when streaming music through Spotify on a run-of-the-mill Android phone. I have yet to fully test battery life but the advertised figures appear accurate, at least based off the battery level shown in the app.In conclusion, I would recommend this speaker to anyone looking for a LOUD Bluetooth speaker, assuming your use case won't involve getting the speaker very wet. If you need a speaker which can be continuously used in wet environments, consider the JBL Boombox instead.Notes:- Ingress protection ratings are cumulative (e.g. a device rated at IPX5 is also rated at IPX4 and so on) only through level 6. Although most devices which can handle short-term submersion can also handle continuous splashes and sprays, it is possible to create one which cannot. Tribit is not making incorrect claims about the water resistance of their speaker (The Stormbox Blast does appear to meet IPX7 standards) but is rather advertising it in a way which may be misleading to some consumers.- Several of the issues with this speaker could be addressed through a firmware update, adding support for aptX Bluetooth audio, increasing the number of volume levels, etc. Given that the speaker has already received several firmware updates and is relatively new, I expect Tribit to improve on its functionality through future updates.- The water resistance of the speaker could be massively enhanced with some modifications. Several teardowns and analyses are available on the Internet as of the writing of this review, and the speaker is designed well from a water-resistance standpoint minus the issues with the control panel. I personally believe that a "control panel protector" could be installed on the top of the speaker and that this would allow it to handle splashes and sprays without issue.- The built-in power supply inside the speaker is massively convenient (makes the charger MUCH smaller than that of the JBL boombox) and is powerful enough to run the speaker at maximum volume continuously. Some other competitors (namely the Anker Soundcore Motion Boom Plus) do not have enough input power capacity to keep up with sustained high-volume use while plugged in. This is a big plus for the Tribit if your speaker will be used in a gym, dance studio, party house, or other situation where it'll rarely see low-volume or battery-operated use.- Most Bluetooth speakers which are covered in lights look cheap and tacky. Tribit does their lighting well, it is not obnoxious and can be turned off if desired. Several other reviewers have seen this as an issue but I personally have no problem with it.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beastly Box with great low frequencies. App EQ availability is a plus
author: Vic
content: The media could not be loaded. Over the years I’ve own many speakers from small to large. I was also a nightclub stagehand and sound guy for years and now with technology getting better and better everything that you use to have to pay an arm and leg for you can get for a fair price. I always wanted to get a bluetooth speaker that has it all, this one is for sure “bang for your buck”. A great value for sure. I’ve had it for about 2 months and I hope it’ll last. Time will tell, but I’m still smiling from the day I took it out of the box. I listen to music everywhere and when my living space tv’s sound got dull this added so much life back to the experiences while watching shows and films. I’m thinking to myself if this was out a half decade before it would of been an easier decision to not spend sixteen hundred on a home theatre system.Out of the box the EQs are not for everyone, pretty good for what they are. Being able to adjust it is a smart move on the company’s part. I included pictures of a universal “U” shape eq setting if you think the “music” or “xbass” eqs are lacking in the highs. this will bring the out bass without drowning out everything else. It’s a nice balance for most genres that need the low and high end to shine (dance, hip hop, latin, meditation, rock).Weighs about 12-15lbs.The battery life claims are probably based on lights off with volume on lowest setting, which isn’t a lie but useless, unless you’re in a sound proof room.With 2 nights of full sleep without interruption I get about a good 16 hours on 30% volume on charge with lights off on my u shape eq with heavy bass before the low battery warning comes on.Updates through the app are easy and simple. The lights are fun but basic with only two settings. Hopefully they add more later. I love this speaker and have nothing to really complain about. I don’t mind the look, feel, weight, size, or anything about it, but the low battery warning has me a little annoyed. I’ll let you know the reason.My wife has high anxiety and we play relaxing sleep beats or sleep frequencies for her to doze off to most nights. So this is a heads up for anyone who wants to use this to bed. When the battery is low, It will constantly let you know with a voice warning that will interrupt your sleep. It a nice feature to have but I got annoyed because for people who use it for sleep like I do you’ll be rudely awaken to shut it off or plug it in. It’s not adjustable in the app. I’ve ask the manufacturer if they’ll include it in the future, and they just stated it’s built in for the user to know the battery is low. My guess is it’s to prolong the battery and keep it from draining all the way for future fails. Not a big deal still a great speaker with lots to love. I have taken it out to the parties, parks and beaches(where my last favorite speaker the 70w w-king x11 would be competing for space, especially against crowds and waves sounds) I am actually going to buy a second one to have stereo pairing. I think the sounds for the price would be great and more portable then a jbl party box 100.(Also try to produce music on the side check out it out on Spotify, Apple Music and here on Amazon Music. MAZARxSKUNK )

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding sound and volume
author: Amazon Customer
content: I’ve now had this for close to two years and use it frequently. The battery last pretty well depending on the volume. I’m always surprised at how loud and clear it can be, and I rarely crank it even in pretty large spaces with people. The sound is very good overall including having good bass, and I’m someone who has subwoofers in my home/vehicle/boat. It made a slight rattle with one woofer one time but it was extremely cold, probably 10 degrees Fahrenheit. Outside of that I’ve used it in lots of cold weather during Michigan winters. I’ve also used it at a lot of tailgate parties around dozens of other tailgaters and it was loud enough to drown most other stuff out when needed. Overall I love it!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars UPDATE: The sound is very good, bass is superb, controlable.
author: bobj90
content: i USED THIS OUTDOORS IN THE MIDDLE OF MY YARD AND THE BASS STILL SOUNDED punchy. Most speakers loose bass because they do not provide enough power. The Tribit has the power needed.This is the first BT speaker in it price range that has blown me away! I like my JBL Extremes but would trade them for this any day.Battery life is not what is advertised for any volume above 20%. For the sound that it puts out at 40%, this is understandable. It maintains the bass up until ~80%, then loses some to prevent distortion. It is LOUD at 3/4 volume level.One thing I like about Tribit speakers is the designed ability for the speaker to be tilted back. This prevents any sound interference from bouncing off the flat surface this may set down on while playing. It makes a difference.The X-bass button is really not needed with this speaker and a decent music source. The bass punches with zero distortion at most sane listening levels. People complain about weight...really? This thing puts 90w of very good sound quality at volume. That means a heavy battery and speaker magnets. I like the lights which can be turned off. It pairs easily with all my devices.These can be paired according to the manual, I do not have a second one to test this. I do NOT use the app, I just use an MP3 player app with good EQ. I do not know if the app is required to pair two of these. Two of these paired is all anyone one would need to throw a house party.

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sounds good, looks like dairy air.
author: Mr Difficult
content: This sounds very good for the price. It's the sonic bargain of Bluetooth right now, truly. Useable app EQ (which you'll need for it to sound it's best, flashy lights, and at least as portable as a medium dog with a handle on it (it's super heavy, for no perceivable benefit to sound relative to other decent-sounding speakers). Nothing this size is ever going to sound truly amazing, but what does come out is relatively impressive - nice job engineers. It does not sound good enough to excuse how hard it is to look at it. It's ugly. Ugly. Alpha. Foxtrot. It is definitely a box, and it has a little boom, but calling it a boombox is an insult to the likes of a JVC RC-M90. This whole class of speakers look like the interior of a 92 Camaro, but this one is . . . extra. Extra big, extra bulky, extra tacky plastic. This thing ought to give me prize tickets when I push play. How about we lose the lights (it would sound as good without inducing seizures) and pay for some designers that didn't spend thirty years at Fischer Price wishing they could work in black.

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great room filling sound!
author: daa69
content: Sound is pretty good for a speaker this size. Weight is nowhere near as bad as some reviews make it out to be, u can carry without an issue, and you can always figure out a strap for it, i used one from a wking d7, which this is only slightly heavier than, use your imagination! I would say this one is better indoors and placed in the right place, gotta experiment, outdoors is ok but if out in the wide open you lose that bass reflection, but that would be the same with any speaker. I don't care about lights, wife likes them, whatever! The app is kind of lackluster, I don't even use it, i have an eq in my phone that works through Spotify so no need. Biggest disappointment for me is the battery, they claim 30hrs, we all know not to ever expect that, however, i used 80% after 12hrs at about the 50% volume, with xbass on, half the time was with lights on. There's no situation i can see myself playing this thing at a much lower volume in order to get close to the 30hrs. All in all, i would say it's a decent speaker, probably one of the best in this category of total portability, you can realistically take it anywhere, whereas the next step up is like a pathfinder or something which is much more bulky and much less portable. I'm ok with it at the $150 mark but at the suggested $199 my opinion drops a little bit, however, for the price of one jbl you can have two of these and you're gonna be a much more satisfied listener! Update, picked up a second one, sounds pretty dang good, especially in a decent size room, you can have a pretty good house party with these things, i set them up diagonal from each other in the corners, facing each other, completely fills the room, and the bass reverb is awesome, you can definitely feel it!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing For the $$$
author: Brent James Pourciau
content: Ok let me first start off by saying I generally put a ridiculous amount of researching multiple brands and different variations of products before purchasing it. Now with that said I can confidently say I made the right choice. I had never heard of Tribit but the reviews outweighed all else so I got it during a lighting deal. Now I already own a Bose sound link and a Bose mini sound link an both of those sound quite good for their size, as expected for a name like Bose…so yesterday after my speaker that sat on the charger 2 nites prior finally got turned on an I was greeted with a pleasant power up cycle of musical key notes instead of the typical bleep, I went into Bluetooth on my iPhone an there it we’d already in there I guess on 1st time pairs at goes into pairing mode so ya super easy…then I connected it to the app I downloaded out the Apple Store which allows you to have a custom EQ or several presets including the X bass feature which is certainly noticeable depending on the song. You can change the synced light show in there see the power status remaining snd so on…I saw a prompt to upgrade to the latest firmware ED. So I did very simple an fast! Now onto the sound I’ll make this easy coming from a musician an audiophile, the Mids are good not great but very exceptional the lows are pretty impressive for a Bluetooth speaker the Highs are well above average for a speaker in this price range and class . I played it for About 2 plus hours steady with the light show an making changes all throughout an at power off it still had 83% remaining, an I was romping it! To sum up I believe I made the right choice…I can’t see where I would find a more powerful great sounding relaxing or partying up Bluetooth speaker anywhere else for this price and be just as happy. If you’ve never really trusted in reviews before let me assure ya I’m extremely scrutinizing of products before purchasing’ don’t worry about researching any further if this is the type of product your looking for fun at the beach or Chilling at home then believe me when I say your search is over! There are many speaker types out there that look similar to this and I’m glad I got this one! Hope This helps your decision making.. God Bless
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States June 6, 2023

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm keeping it anyway.
author: Amazon Customer
content: The media could not be loaded. I speaker shopped for a while. Small space so I need hard hitting base and I won't compromise on a full range dynamic sound either. Some of these, even highly rated or well known names, just can't give you what you need in a compact speaker. SUFFER NO MORE my fellow audiophiles this, hits on all levels. I was looking at Bose, Klipsch Nakamichi and so on but it was comments made in a Harman Kardin review that led me here. I've never heard this quality in such a small package. I had to order it twice. Not to have 2 of them but because the first one"Got lost" about half a mile away on a warm March evening. Long story and not mine to tell lol. Took it out of the box and it Bluetoothed right up. All devices with ease. The auxiliary works too. The sound, dynamic IS the word I would use to describe it. Outstanding sound. Beyond any portable speaker I have ever personally heard. Unbelievable. title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loud, quality sound to fill your next party or outdoor boogie
author: Forrest Ruby
content: At first glance this thing looks a little cheesy. The rainbow light show on the front is a major feature of this boombox and I was hesitant to get it, despite the rave reviews about the quality and loudness of the sound it produces, because it doesn't look like something a man in his 30s would own. Having taking it camping, adventuring, and partying all over the last six months I can say honestly the light show is an attraction about this thing. The rainbow lights dance to the music and fill a dark space with some much needed energy, and it can be changed to solid colors that will change occasionally (though you don't control that), or you can turn them off entirely.That out of the way, let's talk sound. This boombox is loud, and it will easily fill a gathering of a couple dozen people in or outdoors. The bass is really powerful as well and it really takes the energy up a notch when people can feel the bass. It can be boosted as well if that is your preference, and I haven't yet found a loudness at which either the speaker drivers or the woofer plates bleed or cackle. This is a solid device that will deliver you very good sounding playback with the added benefit of powerful bass and an entertaining light show.It is deceptively heavy, because of the sizable rechargeable non-removable battery but the carry handle is built right into the frame for ease of movement. For the price of this thing you are putting yourself in the same range as comparable BT speakers from name brands that sell for 50-100% more. Coming across the review for Tribit on PC Mag was a great find, and I'm glad I gave this brand and box a try. My friends are converts as well and two others have already bought smaller models for their own use. I am a fan and will be proselytizing the gospel of Tribit

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Its heavy and loud
author: Keon B. Billings
content: I was skeptical about the battery, life claims, and about the alleged base that this thing puts out. I can now officially say humbly and with respect that this thing delivers even more so than some reviewers claimed. The base is impressively deep and rich given the size of the speakers, and the battery life went for several hours for me without losing volume. I cannot attest to its acclaimed battery life, but it ran several hour for me, and I am more than happy with its performance.Don't go getting any bright ideas this single speaker can power your house party by itself fill the entire room with sound, etc. etc. It is definitely loud, it definitely have a lot of base for its size, and the battery life is impressive. However, please be realistic in your expectations. When you blast any system, no matter who makes it, Bose, JBL, Sony, beats, it doesn't matter. The higher you push the volume, the more battery it uses, and the shorter your playtime will be. That's just a basic fact of electronics and battery life.That said, this unknown company Tribit have a gem on their hands with this speaker box. I highly recommend it.As for the weight of this thing, I can only assume that it's weight is due to the charge circuit and electronics is inside the unit. Most portable units have a single USB connection that charges the device from an external charge adapter or some other unit plugged into the wall. In the case of this device, all those electronics are packaged inside the unit and seeing that it's enclosed, I'm pretty sure they use more beefy components than normal. That plus the accompanying batteries I believe added up to the weight. Knowing this information, I am more than happy because now I don't have to look for a charger adapter to charge my Bluetooth speaker because it's already inside, I just need to plug it in.If you have not already figured it out, I highly recommend the speaker. It's plenty loud, it's got lots of headroom for highs and lows, and they have great battery life. What more could you possibly want from a Bluetooth speaker?

title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound - Some Limitations
author: Troy Dvorak
content: If you want power and great sound in a small package, Tribit knocks it out of the park. I now own two of their products and am very impressed. That is the very most important thing, of course, when you buy stereo equipment. There is an app you can download that has an EQ which is nice.Sadly, the unit is VERY heavy. What in the world is in there? Second, there are only two lighting options on the unit. So I downloaded the app...only the same two options. Both options are bright and way to busy (multiple colors that sync to the beat). Tribit desperately needs to revamp this to keep up with brands like JBL and Sony. Their Bluetooth speakers allow for wonderful, adjustable ambient lighting. The Stormbox lighting is clearly designed for 14 year old kids having a party (or older people who enjoy inducing their own seizures LOL). Fortunately, there is a third option...OFF.Because the app did not offer any more lighting options, and because I use the EQ in my music app, I deleted the app.Overall, for sound quality, I highly recommend this. For those complaining that there is not enough bass, use the EQ feature on your music app or the Tribit app. You will be just fine.For portability, I do not because of the weight. The lights are also very annoying.Finally, for those complaining that there is no radio, try reading the product information before you buy!!

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars INSANE Speaker! Quality, volume, battery, and features make this THE BEST!
author: Jeremy
content: The JBL Charge 5 is the BEST speaker I have ever owned. I have had the average run-of-the-mill bluetooth speaker that has around a $20 value, for over a year, and I thought it was good sound quality, and I never thought I needed something “fancy.” Well, that speaker started having problems, and I was carefully searching for another speaker. I found this speaker and I thought I would try something new. I only had one thought as I played music out of it for the first time. WOW! The JBL Charge 5 has the best sound quality I had ever heard from a bluetooth speaker. I don’t ever plan on getting another speaker; that is, a speaker that isn’t JBL or an upgraded version of the Charge 5. The clarity is absolutely stunning! The bass is DEEP. I can feel the bass through my whole room! The volume is insane. I rarely have it over 50%, but in the event where I need it louder, I turn it up. I once had music filling a whole event center that was quite a reasonable size. If I could choose one word to describe this speaker, it would be “Stunning,” “Powerful,” or “Supercharged!(Pun intended.)” On that note, the battery life on this thing is long! I once had the speaker provide some background noise for about two days and the battery life was barely lower than 70% (I think…it’s hard to tell exactly with the battery indicator; definitely above 60%). Of course, the battery drains quicker when you have the speaker playing at high volumes. Also, it can take some water. Some being a little, I prefer not to put it to the test. Here is my takeaway:DESIGN: 9/10 Great! I love the fabric covering. The JBL logo is made of metal, which makes it look very nice and official. The buttons are easy to distinguish, and the light is on the power, bluetooth, and there is a ring of light around those two buttons when PartyBoost is in effect. There is a battery bar right below the JBL Logo, and it serves as a general battery indicator. You can get the 100%, 75%, 50%, and 25%. You can get more info on the battery via the app. The weight is surprisingly light, considering the volume this speaker is capable of. Although, it isn’t the most portable of portable speakers as it is a little big and has a football shape. You can get a case for it that has a strap though. For the skip feature, you have to press the play/pause button twice. Make sure that when you do this, you maintain a consistent interval of time between the two presses. If you do it too fast it will just pause. If you do it too slow, it will just pause then play again.BATTERY: 10/10 Perfect! I absolutely love the battery. I’m the kind of person that prefers the longest possible battery, and doing whatever it takes to preserve it. I don’t have to worry much about this battery. Like I said, it has provided some low music for almost 2 days and the battery wasn’t that affected. However, the battery life will drain much more rapidly when using the speaker at high volumes. I currently use this speaker with a projector to watch TV. I have watched lots of movies and TV shows, and I don’t have to pay much attention to the battery. I just plug it in every other night, and it does great! And having a battery bank is the cherry on top. I haven’t used it much, as I keep most of my devices fully charged, but I think it is awesome that it has a battery bank if I need it.SOUND QUALITY: 10/10(10.5/10) Stunning! I didn’t expect that sound quality could get this good for a bluetooth speaker. JBL means business! When I turn it to high volumes, I can actually feel air blowing from it! On that note, it can go REALLY high in volume. I did not expect that at all. Insane volume. As stated earlier, I use this with a projector, and for all my TV. Watching movies with this speaker makes the entire experience cinematic! A much bigger upgrade compared to the sound TV’s come with. I would even say that it can contend with some soundbars out there (not the JBL Surround Sound System though…that one seems like the top-tier of JBL). This speaker was my first experience with JBL speakers (other than the car speakers) and I was very impressed. It has been the best sound experience I have ever had. Really clear and crisp audio, and when I say “really,” I mean truly! When playing music, I can hear every instrument, every breath, and incredible bass. The bass is a superstar in and of itself. Like I said, the bass shakes my whole room when playing music, and when watching movies! The side radiators really, really pack a punch! There is even an adjustable EQ on the app. Though I prefer what the speaker came with. It is a little pricey, (just a little) but know that you get what you pay for! I don’t think that I can ever go back to what I had…PARTYBOOST: 9/10 Great! I had one, so I bought two more so I could create a surround sound with my TV. It kinda worked. I think I had some sort of connectivity issue, so all I’ll say is that the range might not be that great, so make sure you keep them somewhat close. If you have a projector that has bluetooth and you want to use PartyBoost, I would consider researching what you can do with the Bluetooth latency (As stated earlier, I watch TV with this, and please note there IS some lag between sound and video, as bluetooth will do. However, that is just bluetooth technology, not JBL. Over time my ears and eyes have adjusted, and now it is not that big a deal). In addition to standard bluetooth latency, PartyBoost will make this delay greater (I ended up returning the other two because of this issue). For music, this is not a problem, because it is just sound and no video. With music, PartyBoost is pretty cool! It really creates a much louder and much cooler sound experience. You can even use just two for a stereo effect, and it works great!Overall, this has been the BEST bluetooth speaker experience I have ever had. You better believe I’ll be there for the Charge 6 or 7 or wherever they decide to take this. They really have something good going here. I would 110% recommend this! If you are reading this review, and you would like an upgrade to your typical listening experience, know that this is one of the best out there! And if you catch this at a discounted price, you’ll know you are getting a great deal. JBL has been the best listening experience for me. I will continue buying their products if they keep supplying a high-quality experience. I mean, let the 27,000 ratings with a 4.8 overall rating speak for itself. Here is a simplified pro-con list:PROS-Excellent audio clarity-Excellent bass-Excellent overall sound-Exceptional volume-Long battery life-Battery bank feature-Waterproof feature-Adjustable EQ-Stereo Effect-PartyBoost for multiple speakersCONS-Button timing for the skip track-Could be slightly more portable (We do have the Flip speakers for that though)
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2024

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Sound and Great Durability
author: Miguel Gomez
content: The media could not be loaded. I recently got my hands on the JBL CHARGE 5 Portable Waterproof Bluetooth Speaker, and I have to say, it’s been an awesome addition to my music setup. Whether I’m chilling at home, heading to the beach, or just hanging out in the backyard, this speaker has been delivering on all fronts.First off, let’s talk about the sound quality. It’s impressive! The audio is clear and crisp, making everything from podcasts to my favorite tracks sound fantastic. The bass is particularly noteworthy – it’s deep and punchy without being overwhelming. I’ve had other portable speakers before, but this one definitely stands out in terms of delivering that full, rich sound we all crave.The build quality of the JBL CHARGE 5 is also top-notch. It feels solid and durable, which is exactly what you need in a portable speaker. I’m not the gentlest person with my gadgets, so knowing this speaker can withstand a bit of rough handling is a huge plus. The waterproof feature is a game-changer too. I’ve taken it to the pool and the beach, and it’s held up perfectly fine even after getting splashed. No worries about a bit of water ruining the fun.Another awesome feature is the battery life. With up to 20 hours of playtime, this speaker keeps the party going all day and night. And the powerbank USB charge-out is a lifesaver! I can charge my phone on the go, which is super handy during long outings or when I forget to charge my phone beforehand. JBL PartyBoost is another cool feature that lets you pair multiple JBL speakers for an even bigger sound. I haven’t tried it yet, but it sounds like a blast for larger gatherings.Honestly, I’ve struggled to find any real cons with this speaker. It’s a bit on the heavier side, but considering the sound quality and battery life, it’s a trade-off I’m happy to make. The price is a bit higher compared to some other portable speakers, but you’re definitely getting what you pay for in terms of quality and performance.In conclusion, the JBL CHARGE 5 is a fantastic portable speaker that’s worth every penny. With clear, clean sound, excellent bass, and high-quality materials, it’s perfect for anyone looking to amp up their music experience. Whether you’re an audiophile or just someone who loves good tunes on the go, this speaker won’t disappoint. Highly recommended!

title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Audio Engineers point of view
author: Christo
content: I purchased two of these to work as a stereo pair in my apartment to obtain a nice full sound without having to really crank the volume to have an enjoyable experience and bother the neighbors.Well it all started out great, the white look clean and are small enough to not take up too much visual space. They also sound fantastic for a battery powered speaker, relatively full low end and crisp highs without needing to be EQed. They are setup roughly 15’ feet from one another in opposing corners of my studio space. They add presence and a fullness that I was missing from my Notabrick Bluetooth speakers.Now for THE PROBLEMS:I synced the speakers together and switched them to “stereo” mode from the app with no problem using my iPhone 13 Pro running Bluetooth 5.1. When it was time to connect it to my stationary media hub it was intended for (a 2020 iPad 8th gen) it would only connect one speaker and not allow for a party link or stereo link between the two Charge 5’s anymore. It took my some time of testing and no help from the internet to find out that the Bluetooth 4.2 that the iPad uses means the JBLs could no longer connect in a pair. I figured they had their own connection protocol (perhaps wifi 2.4ghz) for party mode. This shared audio functionality will ONLY work if your device that is sending audio is Bluetooth 5.1.SECOND ISSUE:So I put the iPad aside and would only be using my iPhone for music since that’s the only way I could get the Stereo mode to function. But after 15-30 minutes of music playback the speakers will disconnect themselves from one another requiring you to manually go to them and reconnect themselves. Every third time or so they will also drop the Bluetooth connection requiring you to “forget device” on your phone and resync Bluetooth to your host Charge 5 and then relink the speakers.This is all to say that if you want to use more than one speaker, even using a compatible Bluetooth 5.1 device that they are extremely finicky. Using a single Charge 5 has proved to be very reliable, sound great and look great. I am an audiophile and have many thousands of dollars in pro audio.The current tested Firmware version is 0.8.6.0 and has not been updated for over a year so this is unlikely to be fixed.UPDATE: I purchased two Charge 4 speakers to run through all the same testing and scenarios as the newer Charge 5 Models and found that with the exception of the occasional dropout and auto reconnection (perhaps once every two hours or so) these have solved all my issues. In fact, having the Aux plug on this model has also meant I can plugin my DJ decks to them when we are at the park and the primary speaker that is being plugged into will duplicate the signal and send it to the second speaker wirelessly with no issues. There is about one second of lag with this setup so the use of my DJ headphones is a requirement, but I love the added functionality. I also find the battery meters to be much more easy to read on the Charge 4. Finally, I do not know if it's because the transmission power of the Bluetooth 4.2 in the Charge 4 over the Bluetooth 5.1 in the Charge 5, but I find that I get a longer transmission range with no dropouts with the older Charge 4 model. On paper this should be backwards but testing 4 independent units in different scenarios have shown this to be recurring findings for me. I have used the 2020 iPad, iPhone 13 pro and Macbook M1 pro and a HD Firestick as my test subjects.I do notice that the Charge 5 has a slight edge in real world testing for maximum volume and clearly has a crisper high end to it where the Charge 4 sounds a little more round but is still very pleasing to the ear. I suggest to save a ton of money and pickup the Charge 4 if you are planning on using them in a multi speaker setup like me.

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little speakers
author: The pc builder
content: So let start off by I’m old school when it comes to selecting speaker. I have a massive surround system that sound great! I stumbled across the little speaker by accident. So I was doing a cell phone upgrade and they asked if I wanted a Bluetooth speaker versus 2 wireless stands… I opted for the Bluetooth speaker as I had 2 wireless stands that work great. So I hooked this little flip 6 up and was amazed by the sound of this little thing. So I was doing a bit of research and finding that I could hook other speakers. So I opted to pick up another flip 6 and put them into stereo mode. I was floored by the sound out of these little speakers and the stereo field was amazing too!!! So then I was wanting to see how the charge 5 would stack up and then combine them. The one charge 5 has an edge on the bass but the mids and highs of the flip 6 held there ground and sounded a bit better to me. Now I starting thinking of 2.1 sound and this is where everything just shined very bright. Have the best of both worlds highs mids and lows in 3 small speakers!!! Some of the music that I demonstrate in this set up was Rush - The Weapon.. this has some really nice percussion section with some stereo left to right separation. I also played Led Zeppelin’s- Stairway To Heaven for the same reasons or the stereo left to right separation and over rounded sound. Great news it passes with flying colors and I give these 5 stars all day long. I’d like to pick up the extreme 3 and give it a go in this set up as it has the AUX jack that would make it useful enough to hook up external AM/FM with USB and SD card. In closing don’t overlook these speaker I really enjoy my little speaker and I’m sure you’ll love too!!!!

author: donna jenkins
content: My husband bought one of these JBL flip 5 Bluetooth speakers when he was out of town working so his work crew could listen to music while working. Well when he came home I borrowed his to take to work, I am a nurse at a small nursing home and my residents love to listen to music they will come out of their rooms and sit at their doorways so they can hear my music from my flip 5 speaker that I sit on top of my med cart in the hallway and all my residents can hear such great quality music from such a little device. I will even dance in the hallway with them even if they are in wheelchairs or can stand. It is amazing what some good peppy music does for even the elderly people, I can see their whole attitudes change and the smiles on their faces are priceless. One resident that recently passed away from COVID, was sitting in her doorway months ago as I had my flip 5 on and music playing and I asked her who was her favorite musician or song and I like to fell out when this elderly Caucasian female said Michael Jackson and song was Billie Jean so I looked it up on my phone and played it for her and she was in a wheelchair but she still patted her foot to the music and tapped her hand and fingers on her table and at times I could hear her singing along and this made me so happy to do this for her we had a great time that Sunday afternoon and a memory I will never forget This awesome little cute speaker charges up quickly just a few hours and good to go and I have used mine for a whole 8 plus shift even if not playing music it would still be on and I have yet to hear any low battery beeps etc. My husband loves that they are waterproof because of him working outside in the dirt and rain. He said what sold him on buying one for him was a friend he worked with had one also and forgot his hanging on the basket on a line truck and the next morning he got it and had dirt and mud on it so he took it over to the water hose and washed it off and all the dirt and mud can completely off and the water didn't do anything to this flip 5 speaker he shook it as dry as he could get it then hung it back on his bucket on his line truck and turned it on and worked just as good as before. I say if u love music and love even sharing music with others this little speaker is highly recommended by me and my husband. It is simple to connect to his and my iPhones. The buttons on the speakers are very easy to press and can be easily seen on the speaker. Also the volume can be adjusted by my iPhone volume buttons too. It makes the cutest sound when connecting to my phone which tells me is is connected. Never had an issue with it disconnecting for no reason. The range is good that is the range that my cell phone is from the speaker never had an issue with that I play music on it and put my cell in my scrub pocket and I am up and down the hallways and in rooms with doors closed and music keeps playing. I can't think of one problem/issue or complaint about this JBL flip 5 speaker. Worth the money and my residents appreciate me spending this small amount of money for them to have some happiness in their day and I do too. My husband bought his from a person advertising a used one wanting to sell when he was up north working I think he bought his for $50 dollars but I always use my Amazon prime so in case I don't like something I buy or have an issue I can return free and free 2 day shipping. And not very much more did I pay here for mine. I got pink and it is a pale pink not bright pink. I like it. I don't know if my managers at the nursing home that I work at would care or not about me playing music over my speaker but even if they did I would probably still sneak and do it because of the reactions I get from my elderly confused residents the smiles on their faces is why I would go against what a manager tells me not to do and do it anyway. These residents don't get much joy to be honest esp since COVID and isolation since middle of March 2020. They are depressed because they can not see (except through a closed window in their rooms) and can not touch their loved ones we that work there and love everyone of our residents don't replace the touch and hugs ans kisses they would be getting from the people they love the most in this world their children and grandchildren and even great grandchildren we have had residents pass away and they and their families haven't seen or touched since COVID and these are precious memories they can never get back it is depressing to me and I play music to keep all our minds off this depressing situation we are in right now and this little speaker helps me do this and is powerful enough to be heard from my med cart all the way down hallways and inside rooms. So even the residents that are bedridden can still hear some good music. So if u like good quality sound that can come from a small well built Bluetooth speaker that won't break your wallet then please buy this one. It also has a rope handle that my husband uses to hang his off the side of his bucket and it be out of his way. He is a lineman and stands in a bucket with limited room up high off the ground sometimes all day long so the rope handle is strong enough to hang this Light weight speaker from a hook and no worries of it breaking. Also I have accidentally dropped my speaker out of my nursing bad onto the cement floor in the nursing home and scared me because I would have been sick if it had broke my awesome speaker but turned it on and worked as usual I dropped it outside in the parking lot and no issues. Hope my review helps you realize this speaker is a good buy and u will be happy u did buy this one. Thanks
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021

title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Big Bang For The Buck!
author: Diver Dan
content: Purchased for a recent vacation trip and it drew attention. Sound quality is exactly what's to be expected from JBL and frankly, I was pleasantly surprised with it. Hit the bass boost in a large room and away you go! Now I read with interest the poor reviews primarily centered around battery life or lack thereof. I believe the issue(s) with the battery is consumer induced. I charge the unit before using it (the manual suggest not operating it while plugged in) and directly afterwards before storage. After eight weeks of usage, not so much as a hiccup. Now I imagine running the battery low or until the unit shuts down (also not recommended in the owner's manual) and storing in a discharged state is counter intuitive, unless the the operator has an IQ equal to that of a root vegetable. I highly recommend this product... it performs wonderfully and I imagine, as a JBL product, will so for some time to come. Great value for the dollar. Cheers
timestamp: Reviewed in the United States May 26, 2024
